events.venue: Masterton District Council, 64 Chapel St, Masterton
events.description:
Learn how to build a science-based, unforgettable stargazing experience for your business.
Join the Dark Sky Business Capabilities course!
We want people to come to our region again and again to take in the night sky and learn how to look after it.
There is space for everyone in this business, but it takes more than just pointing a laser at the stars to navigate the night sky.
In this course, you’ll learn how to: - Integrate stargazing into your existing business - Design unforgettable dark sky experiences - Use storytelling and science to engage your visitors - Navigate dark sky regulations, gear, and location logistics This is a practical, hands-on workshop designed for tourism operators, educators, accommodation providers, and anyone interested in astro-tourism.

events.id: Deep dive - Traditional Samba de Gafieira Part 2-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Deep dive - Traditional Samba de Gafieira Part 2
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Across six immersive sessions (the first being a practica), we'll Continue to learn the fundamentals of Traditional Samba de Gafieira.
We will continue to deepen your knowledge, continuing on learning the concepts started in the first block of Samba de Gafieira classes.
Week 1: Practice/party/catch up Week 2: Sacada + Sacada Invertido Week 3: Romario Week 4: Pica Pau Week 5: Esse + Esse saida Week 6: Facao + Facinha Samba de gafieira is the partnered version of Brazil’s world-renowned, samba no pe.
Samba de Gafieira is danced to the Brazilian samba musical rhythms and must be distinguished from the ballroom Samba, danced in International Latin and American Rhythm ballroom dance styles.
Check out this demo : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JMGlfr3zA5w It appeared in the 1940s and it gets its name from the Gafieira – popular urban nightclubs of Rio de Janeiro at that time.

events.id: Making & Mending: Cadence Chung, Gregory Kan, Jiaqiao Liu & Nina Mingya Powles | Writers on Mondays-Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Te Papa Tongarewa Museum of NZ, 55 Cable St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Making & Mending: Cadence Chung, Gregory Kan, Jiaqiao Liu & Nina Mingya Powles | Writers on Mondays
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Te Papa Tongarewa Museum of NZ, 55 Cable St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
A poet's toolbox is filled with techniques to help them kick-start or rebuild a poem, but sometimes the tried and true tricks aren't enough.
How can poets engage with other forms of art and artmaking to challenge and reinvent how poetry is written?
New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse talks with Cadence Chung (Mad Diva), Gregory Kan (Clay Eaters), Jiaqiao Liu (Dea Alter) and Nina Mingya Powles (In the Hollow of the Wave) about how their creative pursuits and interests outside poetry shape and inform their latest collections.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa.
The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow.

events.id: DARKFIELD: FLIGHT-Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: DARKFIELD: FLIGHT
events.venue: Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Buying tickets to FLIGHT and SÉANCE?
Book your first experience and then wait to receive your confirmation email to access your unique discount code to book your second experience at a discounted rate.
FLIGHT is an unsettling journey in complete darkness, using DARKFIELD signature 360 degree sound design inside a custom-built shipping container.
The many worlds interpretation of Quantum Mechanics proposes all possible outcomes that could occur, are occurring in countless worlds of varying similarity.
Find comfort in knowing that however ill advised your life choices have been - there is a version of you who made better ones and is suffering less regret and embarrassment.

events.id: DARKFIELD: SÉANCE-Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: DARKFIELD: SÉANCE
events.venue: Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Buying tickets to SÉANCE and FLIGHT?
A twist on a traditional séance relying on psychology and inclination towards superstition to alter your perception of reality.
Step inside, take a seat but don’t get comfortable.
Transforming a shipping container into a Victorian séance room, SÉANCE makes audiences question not just their beliefs, but also their own senses.
SÉANCE explores the psychology of a group of people who have been bombarded with suggestible material, and asks that they believe in what might be conjured up into the room with them.

events.id: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Orchestra Wellington is New Zealand’s oldest professional regional orchestra.
Its busy concert series includes music from classical, romantic, and contemporary periods.
You’ll also see it regularly performing with the Orpheus Choir, Royal New Zealand Ballet, and New Zealand Opera.
The programme includes masterpieces that symbolise the artist’s struggle and resilience under repression and political control.
Coupled with works from other composers, the concerts feature local and international soloists.

events.id: Come Together 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Come Together 2025
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Recreating three entire classic rock albums live is no easy feat.
The crew from Come Together are up for the task — they have been doing it for five years.
The group of famous New Zealand musicians has organised a stellar lineup for 2025.
First up they aim to capture the raw emotion of Neil Young’s album ‘Live Rust’.
Later in the year, they’ll tackle the atmospheric complexity of Pink Floyd’s ‘Dark Side of the Moon’, followed by the thunderous power of Led Zeppelin’s album ‘Led Zeppelin II’.

In 2025 American mezzo-soprano and multi-Grammy Award winner Joyce DiDonato leads the star-studded international list.
At 26, British saxophonist Jess Gillam is the youngest soloist to perform with the NZSO.
Japanese conductor Masaaki Suzuki lends his skills to interpret Baroque works.
Wellington shows are hosted in the Michael Fowler Centre, home of the NZSO.

events.id: Building a More Secure Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Building a More Secure Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
NZIIA Wellington Branch is delighted to welcome members and guests to an upcoming event "Building a More Resilient Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security" This event will bring together the Deputy British High Commissioner to New Zealand John Pearson, and the Chief Operating Officer of Octopus Energy NZ, Margaret Cooney for a fascinating event on how the UK approaches the nexus between climate change, security and economic growth.
Margaret Cooney will discuss her thoughts on clean energy transition, technology and security and talk about what Octopus Energy has done in the UK and their goals in New Zealand.
-Registrations are required to attend this event.
Deputy British High Commissioner to New Zealand John Pearson In the early 2000’s John was the first in the UK to publish on the climate security nexus and helped to inform the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) at the time.
Margaret is dedicated to using technology for more affordable and sustainable energy and fostering a competitive New Zealand energy market.

events.id: Intriguing Textile Treatments & Techniques: Japan, Malay Archipelago & Uzbekistan’s Textile Wonders-Red Gates te Papa, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Intriguing Textile Treatments & Techniques: Japan, Malay Archipelago & Uzbekistan’s Textile Wonders
events.venue: Red Gates te Papa, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Prepare to journey across continents and centuries in “Intriguing Textile Treatments and Techniques”, where Shani & Joji showcase four extraordinary textile traditions that transform humble fibres into unique expressions of culture.
Our discovery takes us from the West of Japan to the South of Japan, then on to the Malay Archipelago (touching down in Malaysia & Indonesia only), and concludes in Uzbekistan in Central Asia.
In Ojiya City, Japan, the winter chill becomes an artisan’s instrument in crafting Ojiya Chijimi.
In contrast, Nagahama City showcases Wana Velvet, an embodiment of 16th-century Portuguese opulence enhanced by Japanese creativity and precision.
https://atitravel.nz/about-ati/talks-presentations/

events.description:

Join us for The AI Advantage, a special edition of HubTalks, where three of Wellington’s leading innovators share real-world lessons on applying AI in business — with impact, integrity, and people at the centre.
Expect an evening of Networking, Nibbles, and Know-How, featuring practical insights from speakers building and scaling AI-powered solutions right here in Aotearoa.
Speakers: Diana Minnée – Co-Founder & CEO, Astronort Taru Peters-Naug – Founder, Do AI Suhel Mangera – Principal Product Manager, LawVu Whether you're a founder, team lead, innovator or just curious about AI, this is your chance to connect, learn, and walk away with real insights you can apply immediately.
Limited seats – please RSVP early.

events.id: Ceremonial Cacao, psychedelics, and neuroplasticity - exploring shamanic practices of Peru-4/Tenancy 4 Coastlands Shopping Centre, Paraparaumu-Facebook
events.name: Ceremonial Cacao, psychedelics, and neuroplasticity - exploring shamanic practices of Peru
events.venue: 4/Tenancy 4 Coastlands Shopping Centre, Paraparaumu
events.description:
Join us for an immersive workshop that bridges ancient indigenous traditions with cutting-edge neuroscience to explore the powerful intersection of cacao, psychedelics, and spiritual transformation.
We will delve into the cosmovision that links cacao with psychedelic plant medicines and how these ancient practices are integrated with modern scientific understanding.
Shamans used ceremonial cacao to connect with the divine and combined it with San Pedro cactus to induce visionary experiences.
If you’re passionate about cacao and curious about its transformative potential, this workshop will expand your understanding and deepen your connection with this sacred plant.
Whether you’re a cacao lover or a seeker on a spiritual path, this experience will open your mind to the possibilities cacao holds for healing, awakening, and change.

events.id: L'Dor V'Dor 2025 - “SEARCHING FOR IDENTITY”-80 Webb Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: L'Dor V'Dor 2025 - “SEARCHING FOR IDENTITY”
events.venue: 80 Webb Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
By Claire Bruell Design & Production by Mike Reganon "This is your history, these are your stories, my gift to you."
But more than a gift to her grandchildren, these books spell out the trauma Jews have faced over millennia and, through her resolute and gently probing of the Bruell and Briess family trees over four generations, she exemplifies the lives of so many.
Claire will describe aspects of the process of creating that content from age 32 through to today, and with Mike, will speak about some of the features of working together and the exquisite joy of laying it all out on paper.
She has been a Justice of the Peace for 30 years and the coordinator of an oral history project in Auckland for almost as long.
Her days are focused on family and community.

events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
English rock and pop group Herman’s Hermits formed in 1963.
Still going strong 62 years later, the band heads to Wellington’s St James Theatre in 2025.
Known for jaunty songs and often tongue-in-cheek vocal style, Herman’s Hermits had many transatlantic hits.
With catchy tunes like Mrs Brown, You Got a Lovely Daughter, Henry the VIII, No Milk Today, and There’s a Kind of Hush, you’ll have plenty to tap along to.
Herman’s Hermits was one of the ‘British Invasion’ bands that followed the success of The Beatles in the 1960s and 70s.

events.description:
Integrating Regenerative Thinking in Adaptation Join us for a morning discussion aimed at intertwining regenerative thinking with climate adaptation.
We will look beyond traditional approaches for addressing climate change including flooding, sea-level rise, urban heat and hydrological impacts.
Featuring compelling international case studies, including a hallmark of proactive climate adaptation planning, the Denmark’s iconic “cloudburst” stormwater management.
We will challenge attendees to adopt a systemic approach to overcoming climate challenges.
Be part of the conversation that aims to shape sustainable and resilient futures for our communities.

events.id: Annual Women's Debate 2025: Parity in Politics-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Annual Women's Debate 2025: Parity in Politics
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
With local elections fast approaching this October 2025, what is being done to achieve a #GenderEqualNZ within our political systems?
In the 2022 local government elections, only 38% of candidates were women.
Despite this being an increase from previous years, significant structural and cultural barriers persist for women seeking to enter and remain in politics.
She'll be joined by a stellar line-up of women: Susan Freeman-Greene, Chief Executive of Local Government New Zealand Tory Whanau, Mayor of Wellington City Afnan Al-Rubayee, senior public servant and community leader Rebecca Matthews, Wellington City Councillor This year’s Annual Women’s Debate will focus on the experiences of women from across the political spectrum and the gendered obstacles they have faced in politics.
Furthermore, the debate will explore what is being done to address barriers to women’s political leadership, and how women representatives can empower a #GenderEqualNZ.

events.venue: 147 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for an immersive workshop  that bridges ancient indigenous traditions with cutting-edge neuroscience to explore the powerful intersection of cacao, psychedelics, and spiritual transformation.
We will delve into the cosmovision that links cacao with psychedelic plant medicines and how these ancient practices are integrated with modern scientific understanding.
Shamans used ceremonial cacao to connect with the divine and combined it with San Pedro cactus to induce visionary experiences.
If you’re passionate about cacao and curious about its transformative potential, this workshop  will expand your understanding and deepen your connection with this sacred plant.
Whether you’re a cacao lover or a seeker on a spiritual path, this experience will open your mind to the possibilities cacao holds for healing, awakening, and change.

events.id: From Selfie to Self-49 Kemp St, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: From Selfie to Self
events.venue: 49 Kemp St, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.description:
We're extremely proud to bring "From Selfie to Self" to Evans Bay Intermediate School on Wednesday 30 July.
We know these parenting techniques have the potential to harm our relationship with our rangatahi and yet during a challenge we can find ourselves on autopilot as we open our mouths and let the words fall out.
We know connection is what our rangatahi need.
Yet they often don’t tell us anything ... until it’s too late.
In this hour-long session we will have a quick look at: ● Brains 101 - what’s happening inside the adolescent brain ● The role of values - what they are and how they affect parent-rangatahi dynamics ● The basics of communication - rapport & active listening ● The drama triangle and how to flip it All designed to get parents thinking about how they can best support their rangatahi in the challenge of self identity while ensuring self responsibility is kept front and centre.

events.name: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
AWHI Yoga and Wellbeing’s accredited 200hr YTT program is a comprehensive and thorough journey into becoming a 200 hr certified Yoga Teacher.
We are the only vinyasa yoga teacher training in the world that blends Te Ao Māori and ancient yoga wisdoms, offering a uniquely 'Aotearoa' experience while retaining universal relevance for teaching and practicing yoga in any part of the world.
Our training is suitable for individuals interested in becoming a yoga teacher, or those looking to take a personal journey towards deepening your own practice and knowledge.
Either way, we guarantee a transformative and life-changing experience that will deepen your relationship to yoga, others, Aotearoa and your self.
A $1,000 deposit reserves your spot.

events.id: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training 2025-34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training 2025
events.venue: 34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Our uniquely Aotearoa yoga teacher training program is a journey into becoming an authentic and well-rounded yoga teacher.
Discover your individual gifts and purpose, and how to share them to impact positive change within your community.
We explore the interweaving of Yoga and Te Ao Māori teachings over five consecutive modules that follows the Māori model of Hauora/Wellbeing of Te Whare Tapa Whā.
Together we work towards a deeper connection to ourselves, to others and to something greater, in order to be of service in this world.
Above all, this journey will hold you deeply in the space of your own healing and self-study.

events.venue: Waimea Road Nelson, Nelson Region 7010
events.description:
Tiaki Whānau, Tiaki Ora – Whānau Champions Training Tiaki Whānau, Tiaki Ora is a one-day wānanga focused on strengthening whānau wellbeing through increased awareness of suicide risk factors and the development of practical, whānau-centred strategies for resilience.
Grounded in the values of whānaungatanga and respectful knowledge sharing, this training offers a safe and empowering space for learning, connection, and support.
Participants will have access to a range of take-home resources to continue the kōrero and apply the tools in their everyday lives.
We look forward to sharing this kaupapa with you and walking alongside whānau on this journey of wellbeing and strength.

events.name: Advanced Leadership
events.venue: Te Awe Awe Street Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui
events.description:
This course will equip experienced leaders with the strategic, emotional, and practical skills necessary to navigate complex organisational challenges.
The course delves into techniques for strategic thinking, communication, emotional intelligence, managing change, and conflict resolution, empowering leaders to drive high performance and embed a culture of excellence.
Key audience This course is suitable for people who have at least 12 month’s leadership experience and who would like to develop their competency further.
It is also suitable for those who have mastered the foundations of leadership and now have their sights set on taking their skills to the next level.
Learning outcomes Understand the importance of strategic thinking and decision-making for effective leadership Utilise communication techniques to manage difficult conversation Explore the impact of emotional intelligence on leadership skills Learn how to lead effectively through change and uncertainty Navigate and resolve complex conflicts while preserving team cohesion Learn how to build a high-performance culture supported by good coaching If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

events.id: Introduction to Meshtastic-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Introduction to Meshtastic
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
As the Christchurch Earthquake and Cyclone Gabrielle have shown, in an environmental disaster, Internet infrastructure and mobile communications are unreliable at best.
This 2 hour session will introduce participants to the Meshtastic platform, a post-internet mesh network in broad use in Pōneke/Wellington.
Meshtastic allows for sending messages even in a total blackout, right from your phone.
The Lower North Island already enjoys a very populous and active Meshtastic mesh, with many members focused on preparedness.
Come and learn how you can help strengthen and grow the community!

events.id: Exhibition Opening: Finn McLachlan - These Islands Are Not Still-272 Taranaki Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Exhibition Opening: Finn McLachlan - These Islands Are Not Still
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.description:
--- Artist statement: "New Zealand's subantarctic islands aren't very well known, even among New Zealanders.
Often seen in the form of a still image, I aimed to observe and then prove that these islands aren't still; they are thriving, dynamic ecosystems.
The physical process of capturing digital video is to most people an entirely abstract process that creates a certain barrier or disconnect between the viewer and the subject.
The inner workings of this camera are simplified to the extreme.
Then, if you play these photos back at the same rate as they were taken, it creates a moving image (2s of 12fps).

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Can’t work out why some plants thrive and others barely survive?
Ready to make exciting changes but no idea where to start and not much gardening background?
Time permitting, we will look at photos of your gardens as “personal case studies” to help you get the most from the course.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: •Identify the style of your dream garden and learn what plants will best achieve this and guarantee success • Identify and work with the site and climate conditions of your garden/outdoor areas to be developed; modify plant choices if necessary • Accurately draw your detailed planting design on paper and to scale.
This is available in a separate course.

events.id: Raising Great Kids In An Overindulgent World-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Raising Great Kids In An Overindulgent World
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Parenting today delivers unprecedented challenges – are you wondering what went wrong and somehow ended up living with a child you don’t recognise as should be belonging to you?
They have few self-care skills and skills relating to others, can’t take personal responsibility and don’t know what is enough or what is “normal” for others – these children end up having a difficult time of it in life and you will too.
You’ll take away new insight and knowledge plus strategies that you can apply that very night to help your child to be a responsible, likeable and respectful person.
By the end of the session, you’ll be able to: - Reflect on the current context parents are faced with today - Find the relevant research - Practise the parenting tools and discuss the model - Know where to go to get support Aimed at parents, grandparents and caregivers of children of all ages.
Presented by Madeleine Taylor.

events.id: Raising Great Kids in an Overindulgent World-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Raising Great Kids in an Overindulgent World
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Raising Great Kids in an Overindulgent World This workshop will be a confronting one that will expose you to the risks that children face in this modern overindulgent world.
Many have become used to being the constant centre of attention and are unable to delay gratification and aren’t competent in everyday skills.
They have few self-care skills and skills relating to others, can’t take personal responsibility and don’t know what is enough or what is “normal” for others – these children end up having a difficult time of it in life and you will too.
You’ll take away new insight and knowledge plus strategies that you can apply that very night to help your child to be a responsible, likeable and respectful person.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses.
It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.
There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.
What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise - 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say - 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes) - 1:40pm - Educational topic - 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.

events.name: TGIF - Ānō he ahi tawa (Trombone quartet)
events.venue: Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Matthew and Shannon are members of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra and serve respectively as Artist Teacher and head of Brass and Winds at the New Zealand School of Music.
Leo is undertaking a Master of Fine Arts as part of an internship with NZSO under Principal Trombone, David Bremner.
Natania recently finished her Honours degree at the New Zealand School of Music and will begin a Master of Music at the Manhattan School of Music in September, studying with Colin Williams Associate Principal Trombone of the New York Philharmonic.
The quartet’s name comes from a kiwaha “Ā nō he ahi tawa” which translates to mean “what a rowdy noisy lot” in English.
The kernel of the berry has also been a traditional food source for Mā ori and makes a very loud crackling and snapping sound when it is burned.

events.name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells
events.venue: Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The new pieces commissioned for this series continue to stretch at the fabric of jazz and improvised forms, and are inspired by Morton Feldman, Lennie Tristano, Henry Threadgill and Sly Stone.
Callum has been deeply involved in the New Zealand jazz and improvised music scene for over a decade, and is a busy freelancer in the wider music community in Auckland.
He has performed with Aldous Harding, Hans Pucket, the Exploding Rainbow Orchestra, the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, among many others.
In 2021, Callum was commissioned to compose a large-scale work 'Solid Spirit, Liquid Body' for the Wellington Jazz Festival.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers.

events.id: Tessa Frazer & Friends-211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tessa Frazer & Friends
events.venue: 211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Tessa Frazer & Friends is a chamber music concert featuring classical saxophonist Tessa Frazer, joined by musicians from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra Wellington, and beyond.
The programme highlights the versatility of the classical saxophone through a range of chamber works for trumpet, piano, violin, bass trombone, flute, and saxophone.
Curated by Tessa, the concert features some of her favourite repertoire and presents the saxophone in a fresh and dynamic context.
All proceeds will support Tessa’s upcoming move to the Netherlands, where she will begin a Master of Music at Codarts, Rotterdam, studying under renowned saxophonist Femke IJlstra.

events.id: Yoga Nidra-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga Nidra
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
Yoga Nidra, often referred to as "yogic sleep," is a deeply restorative practice that promotes physical relaxation, mental clarity, and emotional balance.
It's the perfect way to rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul: your hinengaro, tinana and wairua.
What to Expect: - A 90-minute guided Yoga Nidra Meditation led by one of our experienced instructors - A comfortable space to lie down (mats, blankets, bolsters & cushions provided) - A supportive community of fellow meditation enthusiasts - Complementary herbal tea before/after the session; - An opportunity to journal your experience, if desired - A chance to destress and cultivate inner calm Yoga Nidra is for everyone and no prior experience is required - everyone is welcome to experience the profound benefits of Yoga Nidra with us.
Wear comfortable clothes, and bring an open mind, a journal and eye mask if you have one (not required).
So, mark your calendar for the first Friday of each month and treat yourself to an evening of deep relaxation and mindfulness.

events.id: Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place-Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place
events.venue: Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists.
Stephen Gallagher is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance.
From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling.

events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Kia ora, we are honoured to launch our Look For Gold digi EP with a release party ft Whirimako Black in Dub & Bass at Meow, Wellington on Friday Aug 1st.
The Sal Dub SoundSystem bring an epic 3hr dance floor journey through the band's back catalogue of remix anthems.
Space weave through the Dub's bass lands with an audio visual mashup ft. Whirimako Black Mighty Asterix with the Sal Dub horns and special guest Ladi J.

The Mighty Asterix over our Kings Birthday weekend shows in Lyttelton, Rangiora, Hokitika and Wellington at the end of the month.

events.id: Salmonella Dub Soundsystem-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Salmonella Dub Soundsystem
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Salmonella Dub originator Andrew Penman (aka Dj Rudeboy) drives the Sal Dub SoundSystem Machine featuring the Mighty Asterix & Whirimako Black on vocals with the epic Sal Dub horn section live.
Salmonella Dub began writing with Whirimako Black after touring with the band on their Feel The Seasons Change live with the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra summer shows of 2008.
Look For Gold is the bands new 4 track EP featuring Whirimako on all four tracks.
The title track Look For Gold - [I'm Coming Alive Low-Phi Rockers Dub] - ft. Whirimako Black is an unreleased dub track written during the bands For All Things Alive album sessions cross pollinating Whirimako’s Return to our Kowhai vocal with a stripped back dub of Andy’s Jam produced by Harry Bretherton.
The bands Salmonella Dub SoundSystem ft. Whirimako Black, the Mighty Asterix and Dub horns are out touring the bands new releases over May & June in preparation for the bands remastered digital back catalogue re-issue.

events.id: Field Day: Wellington International Airport - 2 Aug 2025-Station Drive off Stewart Duff Drive, Rongotai , Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Field Day: Wellington International Airport - 2 Aug 2025
events.venue: Station Drive off Stewart Duff Drive, Rongotai , Wellington
events.description:
Get a behind the scenes look at Airport operations including the Airport Fire Service, their equipment and capabilities, how they operate day-to-day and in the event of an emergency on site, plus gain knowledge of other Airport functions that the public may not ever get to see.
This field day will allow participants to get an understanding of airport operations including Operations, AVSEC, Customs, MPI and the Control Tower.
We will also look at the Airport Fire trucks, equipment, PPE, simulator/training aids and discuss how they respond to incidents in and around the airport and show you what the day-to-day life of an Airport Firefighter looks like.
What the capabilities (and limitations) of Wellington Airport Fire are.
The fee must be paid at registration to secure your spot.

events.id: Sewing - The Basics-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Sewing - The Basics
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Sewing - The Basics Learn the essential sewing skills you need to get you started in this one-day workshop.
You'll take away your own lined bag and lots of ideas and inspirations for further projects.
A list of materials to bring (approximate cost $50) will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed.
By the end of the workshop, you'll have been introduced to basic sewing skills and you'll be able to: • Use sewing machine equipment and demonstrate basic sewing techniques (basic seams and finishes) • Cut out and construct a lined bag using techniques learned • Line a bag • Work on a pin cushion (if time allows) Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.id: Cheesemaking - Brie and Queso Fresco-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Cheesemaking - Brie and Queso Fresco
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Cheesemaking - Brie and Queso Fresco The ultimate class in practical cheese making!
Learn all you need to know to replicate making NZ style Brie and Queso Fresco at home.
You will be guided through each step of the cheesemaking process while making your very own round of Brie.
A small break will be provided and you will have the opportunity to purchase equipment and cheesemaking ingredients after the workshop should you wish to replicate the experience at home.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Make Brie and Queso Fresco - Recall the best milk to use and where to source it from - Name and identify what equipment and ingredients you need to make Brie and Queso Fresco Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Get the Job: CV and Cover Letters-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Get the Job: CV and Cover Letters
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Identify your key skills and weave these into your CV and cover letter to land you your next job interview.
Whatever job you are going for, there are key characteristics that should not be missed in your CV and cover letter.
The focus of this course is to provide you with the same lens as a recruiter.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Recognise the features of an effective, well-crafted CV and cover letter and apply these to your own job applications; - Apply different approaches, styles and techniques while writing your CV and cover letter depending on the context and job; - Help others with their CV and cover letter writing (friends and whānau).
Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Overcoming Imposter Syndrome for Creatives There is a widespread ‘lack of confidence’ epidemic among creatives, and if you have ever felt like your work is not good enough, hesitated to submit your art to competitions, or doubted your skills when applying for creative jobs, you are not alone!
Creatives often feel imposter syndrome most acutely.
This concise workshop is designed to help you uncover the roots of this inner voice of insecurity and provide you with effective tools to overcome it.
Through engaging activities and practical exercises, you will learn how to transform self-doubt into a source of strength, empowering you to confidently share your unique talents with the world.
Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

Do you often feel your creative work isn't good enough or worry about sharing it with others?
Join our workshop to explore the roots of imposter syndrome and discover practical strategies to boost your confidence, allowing you to proudly showcase your art to the world.
There is a widespread ‘lack of confidence’ epidemic among creatives, and if you have ever felt like your work is not good enough, hesitated to submit your art to competitions, or doubted your skills when applying for creative jobs, you are not alone!

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
You'll learn to differentiate different parts of the pelvic floor, and also how the pelvic floor functions in conjunction with breathing and spinal movements.
By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to: • Recognise the anatomy of the pelvic floor, where the muscles are and how they work • Coordinate the pelvic floor muscles with breathing, and with the spine, and recognise its role in overall good posture • Discover what habits you have which work against your pelvic floor muscles working well • Practise exercises designed to help you rehabilitate and strengthen your pelvic floor Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.
For women only.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.id: Beginner's Weekend-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Beginner's Weekend
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
A fabulous and fun introduction to jewellery making over two mornings, this is our most popular short workshop!
We begin with ring making as this process teaches students many fundamental techniques in one project, measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, soldering and finishing are all included in this one ring.
They are shown how to use a jeweller’s saw to cut their metal to the correct length, how to form it up and how to solder.
Then they learn how to shape their rings and finish them up into a wearable piece of jewellery, all in the first class!
Students can spend their afternoon and evening thinking about and planning their design in silver for the next day.

events.id: Botanical Watercolour on Calf Vellum-101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Botanical Watercolour on Calf Vellum
events.venue: 101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:
'Have you ever wondered what all the fuss is about vellum?
Botanical artist, Lesley Alexander will share her knowledge of painting on vellum.
Used as a writing and painting surface since before the Middle Ages, Lesley loves the luminosity and glow that can be achieved working this traditional way.
You will learn: what vellum is how it is prepared it's uses now and in times past how to prepare the vellum with pumice powder and watercolour techniques to work on this very beautiful surface before spending the rest of the time painting a small colourful Pohutukawa leaf.
Ideally you will have some experience using watercolour but that is not essential.

events.id: NZ Species Edit-a-thon 2025-150 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: NZ Species Edit-a-thon 2025
events.venue: 150 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:
As the internet is increasingly taken over by sponsored posts and AI-generated content, Wikipedia remains steadfast as a source of verifiable, up-to-date information.
All are welcome – whether you’re a complete newbie or have experience editing – take this opportunity to develop your skills while contributing to the world's most comprehensive encyclopedia.
We'll provide all the training and resources you need to get started, and the native vegetation of Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush will provide the perfect location for collaborating with fellow nature enthusiasts to share our unique biodiversity with the world.
Whether you want to come along for just one day, or book in for both, we’re looking forward to having you join us.
You can also come by car and park in the main public car park on Wilton Road or along Churchill Drive.

events.id: Radio Cartography-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Radio Cartography
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This one day event will involve getting out and about around Wellington CBD in an attempt to map it for radio shadows (communication blindspots) within the Lower North Island Meshtastic network.
The outcome will be a map which identifies areas where we need to install nodes to give coverage across the CBD.
These could become mission-critical to reaching loved ones in the event of an earthquake or blackout event.
We will meet at Critical Signals, 115 Taranaki Street, then head out into the city, rain or shine.

events.id: Silk Aquatint Printmaking-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Silk Aquatint Printmaking
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
Discover the silk aquatint, an accessible, non-toxic alternative print technique similar to collagraph printing whereby the texture of woven silk on the plate provides a ground to start building a design with varying tonal qualities.
The outcome can be wonderfully detailed and painterly.
In this workshop you will learn - - To identify appropriate silk to create an aquatint plate - The importance of preparing an appropriate matrix for the silk - About the different effects created by different types of media applied to the print matrix - To make an aquatint plate - To print an aquatint plate This workshop is open to beginners as well as seasoned printers.
Basic materials included.
Bring drawings or designs to help you get started and wear clothes you are not precious about.

events.id: NZ's Top Dog Film Festival 2025-Coco At The Roxy, 5 Park Rd, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: NZ's Top Dog Film Festival 2025
events.venue: Coco At The Roxy, 5 Park Rd, Wellington
events.description:
The beloved Top Dog Film Festival is back at the Roxy on Saturday 2 Aug, 12.30pm for another heartwarming season, with a brand-new line-up of short films that celebrate the extraordinary connection between dogs and humans.
Touring around NZ, the 2025 festival features tales of adventure, resilience, and canine joy — reminding us why dogs truly are our best friends.
This year’s curated collection brings together incredible real-life stories from around the world — from bloodhounds tracking poachers in Africa to ultra-running Vizslas in the Pacific Northwest, pampered hotel pups, and unlikely sporting heroes.
Whether it’s laughter, tears, or feel good moments you’re after, the 2025 Top Dog Film Festival delivers it all, one wagging tail at a time.

Whether you’re a seasoned whisky connoisseur or a newcomer to the world of rye, this is your chance to indulge in an experience that is as rich in history as it is in flavour.
Come for the food, stay for the stories, and savour every sip as we raise a glass to the love of good taste and great company.

events.id: Troy Roberts Masterclass-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Troy Roberts Masterclass
events.venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
This afternoon is a rare opportunity to catch internationally renowned saxophonist, Troy Roberts presenting a masterclass on topics including improvisation, approaching standards, and a discussion of a life in jazz.
The New York City based Australian immigrant is a prolific leader with sixteen releases to his name.
Currently celebrating his latest, Green Lights (featuring John Patitucci, Paul Bollenback and Jimmy Macbride), Roberts maintains a busy recording and performance schedule with his quartet, his original project Nu-Jive, as well as some of the greatest artists of today.
Embracing his love for a vast variety of stylistic genres, the three-time GRAMMY nominated saxophonist is quickly becoming one of the most widely recorded touring artists of his time.
As a go-to first call saxophonist, his name adorns several essential recordings ranging from the legendary Joey DeFrancesco, the iconic Van Morrison, the quintessential Jeff "Tain" Watts, the tireless Orrin Evans Captain Black Big Band, the critically acclaimed Kurt Elling, the breathtaking Veronica Swift, to numerous other jazz veterans, and newcomers considered tastemakers of their generation.

events.description:

Troy Roberts continues to be a master of styles and configurations with this eminently accessible, sonically and rhythmically engaging session, emitting steam and sumptuous harmonic colours along the way.
As a go-to first call saxophonist, his name adorns several essential recordings ranging from the legendary Joey DeFrancesco, the iconic Van Morrison, the quintessential Jeff "Tain" Watts, the tireless Orrin Evans’ Captain Black Big Band, the critically acclaimed Kurt Elling, the breathtaking Veronica Swift, including numerous other jazz veterans, and newcomers considered tastemakers of their generation.
The New York City based Australian immigrant is also a prolific leader with sixteen releases to his name.
Currently celebrating his latest, Green Lights (featuring John Patitucci, Paul Bollenback and Jimmy Macbride), Roberts maintains a busy recording and performance schedule with his quartet, his original project Nu-Jive, as well as some of the greatest artists of today.

events.description:

Is the unknown of one's life journey really a curse or is it a blessing?
It’s like driving through the fog, trying to see ahead.
Have those past rejoin your life again, look forward to your best days and prepare for your worst) Sage: Now beginning life with insight and awareness, you pass on this wisdom and guide those close.
Exuberant: The one that is left now returns to life, bringing back all innocence and purity to the joyfulness of early life.

events.id: The Warratahs-11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Warratahs
events.venue: 11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
events.description:
The Warratahs Live at the Upper Hutt Cossie Club – Saturday 2nd August After nearly four decades on the road, The Warratahs remain one of New Zealand’s most beloved bands — and now they’re returning to the Upper Hutt Cossie Club for a very special show.
With 37 years of touring behind them, The Warratahs have left a deep mark on Kiwi music.
Their legacy includes seven studio albums that made the charts, a Tui Music Award for Country Album of the Year in 2017, and performances alongside legends like Johnny Cash & The Highwaymen, Lucinda Williams, and Jackson Browne.
Barry Saunders’ iconic songwriting is woven into the fabric of the New Zealand songbook, and this is your chance to witness the band at their best.
Born out of a simple love for playing music with mates down at the pub, The Warratahs first hit the stage at The Cricketers’ Arms in Wellington in 1986 — never imagining they’d become a national treasure.

Join Afro-Kiwi artist InDuna to celebrate the release of his brand new EP, ‘Go High’, live at Moon, Wellington on Saturday 2nd August.
‘Go High’ is a gift from InDuna’s younger self to the artist he is today.
It's an uplifting and reflective Afro-pop project inspired by his South African roots and journey of resilience.
The EP is a reminder to keep dreaming boldly, no matter the obstacles.

events.description:
Join Afro-Kiwi artist InDuna to celebrate the release of his brand new EP, ‘Go High’, live at Moon, Wellington on Saturday 2nd August.‘Go High’ is a gift from InDuna’s younger self to the artist he is today.
It's an uplifting and reflective Afro-pop project inspired by his South African roots and journey of resilience.
The EP is a reminder to keep dreaming boldly, no matter the obstacles.Doors open: 9:00 PMShow starts: 9:30 PMVenue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, WellingtonMoon is a wheelchair-accessible venue with both seated and standing options available.When the NFC ticket bundle is purchased, fans will get exclusive access to a limited edition NFC-enabled EP, featuring the full EP plus unreleased demos and future tracks, delivered directly to your device before they’re available anywhere else.
InDuna merchandise will also be available on the night — don’t miss it.About InDuna:Self-taught artist and producer InDuna blends Afro-pop with the vibrant spirit of his South African heritage.
He was recently honoured with the Young Global Achiever Award at the 2024 Prince’s Trust Awards in London and recognised at Buckingham Palace by King Charles III.His music has reached global ears, with his track ‘Dreams’, written for the documentary Ink and Gold: An Artist’s Journey to Olympic Glory, winning Best Original Song at the International Online Web Fest and climbing to #6 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart.

events.id: Correct Colour Pencil Techniques for Botanical Drawing-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Correct Colour Pencil Techniques for Botanical Drawing
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Colour pencil is an exciting art form when practiced correctly, and works well with creating beautiful botanicals.
In this workshop Sandra will share the tips and tricks she has used in her botanical drawings.
You will learn: • How to capture the shape and form of your flower or leaf using basic shapes to start with.
• Working with the correct colour for undertone to create light and dark • How to achieve clean veins and /or fine hairs • How to achieve highlights • The most suitable tools for blending.
• Suitable for all skills level ages 15years+ Materials provided: colour pencils & paper Materials participants need to bring: - HB pencil - Tombow clutch eraser rounded or similar (example: https://www.gordonharris.co.nz/product/22770-tombow-mono-zero-eraser-pen-round?categoryId=1454) - Double ball stylus or similar (example: https://www.gordonharris.co.nz/product/2777-double-ball-stylus-1-2mm-2-8mm) Venue location: Akoranga Learning Pavilion in the Discovery Garden at Wellington Botanic Garden Google Maps: https://maps.app.goo.gl/PQdG7LCYSKEDYgKA8 Please note: This event requires a minimum of 8 bookings to go ahead.

events.id: Glass Bead-Making Taster-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Glass Bead-Making Taster
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.description:
This class is a great way for absolute beginners to get a taste of working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways, including making a unique gift for your loved one (or yourself!).
As one of the earliest forms of human adornment, beads have long functioned as a way to express individuality, and what better way to do that than to learn to make your own unique beads?
Students are shown correct lampworking techniques to produce several decorative beads in just 3 hours!
How many beads you make is up to you, some students make up to 10 while others make fewer using trickier techniques.
Kids over 12 (or so) are welcome to take the class but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Manawa Karioi Working Bees-7 Danube St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Manawa Karioi Working Bees
events.venue: 7 Danube St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.description:
Our track maintenance and planting working bees are focussing on plant species diversity rather than large planting quantities.
We have ordered 500 special trees from the Berhampore Nursery.
We are in this for the long haul and a forest that contains a wide range of plant species will, in turn, attract a wider range of birds, lizards, and invertebrates.
A wider range of plant species also allows for the forest to naturally regenerate and helps prevent weed species from establishing.
Tools are provided, bring sturdy shoes and a water bottle, Working bees are held every Sunday in June (except June 1st - Kings Birthday Weekend) and August 2025.

events.id: Nature Journaling-Rudderstone Dennis Oconnor, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Nature Journaling
events.venue: Rudderstone Dennis Oconnor, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:
A gentle ramble around parts of the botanic gardens with botanical artist Sandra Morris, using careful observation and journalling techniques to record how our personal connection with our environment changes our perception and wellbeing.
You will learn: • Different ways to observe and the practice of mindfulness and wellbeing • Different ways to record visually, eg.
diagrams, sketches, careful drawings, maps, graphs • Different ways to record in words, numbers • Approaches to page layout • Suitable for all skill levels- with a desire to learn to observe and connect with the natural world around you.
Materials participants need to bring: - sketch book A5 or A4 or photocopy paper with backing board with clip for attaching paper to board - drawing pencils and/or drawing pens - colour pencils or whatever you prefer to work with Venue location: Akoranga Learning Pavilion in the Discovery Garden at Wellington Botanic Garden Google Maps: https://maps.app.goo.gl/PQdG7LCYSKEDYgKA8 Please note: This event requires a minimum of 8 bookings to go ahead.
If fewer than 8 people register, the event will be cancelled and any fees paid will be fully refunded.

events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Create your own ring stack from copper, brass and silver in this fast and fun workshop!
Perfect for an outing with friends or as a treat for yourself This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.
Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches.
Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new rings will be ready to wear.
Students can choose to use silver, copper and brass wire to make a textural and multi-tonal ring stack.

events.id: Ghost Trio-Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Ghost Trio
events.venue: Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae
events.description:
Programme Beethoven: Piano Trio, Opus 70, No 1 "The Ghost" Takemitsu: Between Tides Glen Downie: Sonata da chiesa Shostakovich: Piano Trio No 2, Opus 67 The Ghost Trio will perform in Waikanae as part of a Chamber Music New Zealand tour.
Popular New Zealand musicians Monique Lapins (violin), Ken Ichinose (cello) and pianist Gabriela Glapska are all familiar faces on the Waikanae stage, having appeared with numerous other chamber ensembles.
Two brief and contrasting works complete the first half of this varied concert.
The second half of the concert will be dominated by one of the greatest piano trios of the 20th Century - Shostakovich's Opus 67.
It is an elegy for the tragic victims of war, but also expresses Shostakovich's grief at the sudden death of his closest friend and mentor Ivan Ivanovich Sollertinsky.

events.description:
Directed by Alfred Hitchcock Starring Joseph Cotten, Teresa Wright --- Uncle Charlie - a killer just one step ahead of the law - travels to the sleepy town of Santa Rosa under the pretence of visiting his relatives.
But his favourite niece and namesake - Young Charlie - soon begins to suspect that her uncle is the Merry Widow Murderer, setting in motion a deadly game of cat-and-mouse.
--- This is a TEA TIME TALKIE screening where a delicious Devonshire Tea* awaits for upgraded tickets holders (a cup of tea and traditional homemade scones with cream and jam).
This is served upstairs in the Grand Lobby during the intermission.
Admit only tickets are available for $15 or you can upgrade to include a Devonshire Tea for $24.

events.description:
This set will feature stripped back arrangements of his songs accompanied with string arrangements performed by Karen Hu (cello), and Hijiri Yamamoto (violin).
Ben Chavasse is a 26-year-old singer-songwriter based in Tāmaki Makaurau.
His lyric-forward approach embraces the indie-folk genre while incorporating rock, punk, and jazz influences.
He explores themes of adolescence, mental health, and reconciliation through an introspective, reflective and vulnerable lens.
She has many fond memories of singing with Ben together in their flat in Auckland during the 2021 lockdown.

events.id: The Wellington Classical Guitar Society Presents Barry Holt in Concert-Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Wellington Classical Guitar Society Presents Barry Holt in Concert
events.venue: Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
For Sunday’s performance, Barry will be playing a selection of his own work from two previously released albums: Etudes Old & New and Nuevo Direccíon, and a new study entitled Gallope Espangóle.
Barry, originally from Liverpool, is based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
With a Bachelor of Music from Otago University and a love of classical guitar, he has a strong interest in music for film and soundscape / spoken word music production.
He has performed in the UK, Australia and Aotearoa and releases original music under his own label.
One reviewer described his music as ‘campfire session with a classically trained Romany traveler.’ Most recently he performed at Wellington’s Gardens Magic Summer Series and Old St Paul’s “Musical Punch Over Lunch series” in Thorndon.

events.id: Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington-13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington
events.venue: 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.description:
***$20*** Limited door sales for $25 *Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket- or whatever it is you need to feel warm and comfortable* Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session.

events.venue: Wellington
events.description:
Winner of the prestigious Acorn Prize for Fiction at the 2025 Ockham New Zealand Book Awards, Damien Wilkin's profoundly moving new novel, Delirious, explores untimely loss, ageing, and surprise second chances.
As well as being one of our most acclaimed novelists and Director of the IIML, Wilkins is a not-to-be-missed speaker.
He appears in conversation with writer Emily Perkins to discuss the art of fiction, a career that spans 14 books, and where singing and songwriting fit into it all.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa.
The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow.

events.id: Server Gardening with Julian Oliver-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Server Gardening with Julian Oliver
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This lecture, delivered by Julian Oliver, will introduce participants to the potentials and pitfalls of self-hosted server infrastructure, whether that be a PC-turned-server hosted at home, studio or office, or on a server rented at a datacenter.
Starting points for self-hosting will be covered, with an introduction to system administration in the context of digital caretaker, guardian and gardener.
The lecture will position self-hosting as an act of infrastructural resistance and reclamation in an era of pervasive digital imperialism and extractivism.
The talk will also assess free and open source platform alternatives to Big Tech, from cloud, to webmail, forum, team chat, and more.

events.id: Weather Commoning: Chris Berthelsen-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Weather Commoning: Chris Berthelsen
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Critical Signals from the Japanese Government's Moonshot Goal 8 Project The Japanese government's Moonshot Goal 8 project aims to create a society safe from extreme winds and rains by controlling the weather by 2050.
The Weather Commons Research Group, led by Tsuyoshi Hatori (Ehime University), is developing and exploring 'weather commoning’.
This involves the exploration of symbiotic relationships with weather patterns and disasters, non-normative ethics based on local community practices, and citizen participation in technological development.
Please join weather commons group leader Tsuyoshi Hatori and member Chris Berthelsen (originally Tāmaki Makaurau) for an introduction to the state of weather control, calming, and commoning research and activity in Japan.
This is a space for open discussion, but you are also free to sit back and listen.

events.id: Ka Mua, Ka Muri: an Introduction-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder

events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Nau mai, haere mai, we are proud to present the Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, an informative lecture series about the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of The Waitangi Tribunal held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
Therefore, we announce with great pleasure that noted historian Dame Claudia Orange DNZM OBE CRSNZ will present our opening lecture in this series, which focuses on the history of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and the Waitangi Tribunal.
Encouraging discussion on the Treaty of Waitangi is a vital part of continuing efforts to fulfil the promise of the 1840 agreement.
Dame Claudia argues that a broad public understanding of the changes that have occurred in the Māori–Crown relationship is essential in order for those relationships to grow.
The exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of The Waitangi Tribunal will remain open to view until 8pm.

Introducing Shostakovich: Unpacked.
Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers.
We invite you to join us on the journey of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”, as together we explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, but also how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.
Concert Two: Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Antipodes Quartet Artists onstage: NZSQ / Antipodes Quartet Shostakovich: 6th and 7th String Quartets, String Octet Unpacked: The music of Gao Ping Spotlight: Be part of Aotearoa’s musical history, as the first chapter of the newly formed Antipodes Quartet unfolds in their Wellington debut.
Created as part of a visionary new partnership between NZSQ, Chamber Music New Zealand, and the Adam Chamber Music Festival, the next generation of leading chamber musicians step forward; two string quartets artistically colliding, joining forces to perform Shostakovich’s gripping octet.

events.id: NZAC Wellington: Beyond the mountains – The growth of rock climbing in Aotearoa from the late 1960's-Tararua Tramping Club Inc., 4 Moncrieff St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: NZAC Wellington: Beyond the mountains – The growth of rock climbing in Aotearoa from the late 1960's
events.venue: Tararua Tramping Club Inc., 4 Moncrieff St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for our next section night!
This project traversed 60 years of modern rock climbing activities, from the first graded routes at Long Beach, Castle Rock, and Tītahi Bay in the 1960s, through the 'anarchic' era of Whanganui Bay in the early 1980s and the heyday of Women Climbing, to the boom of indoor climbing, competitions, sport climbing, and bouldering from the 1990s and into the 21st century.
Natalie will speak about the early years of rock climbing in Aotearoa, and why a new generation of New Zealand mountaineers in the 1960s turned to rock climbing on crags as a 'safer', yet equally exciting, form of climbing.
Everyone is welcome at our section nights – see you there!
Photo credit: New Zealand Alpine Journal 31 (1978), photo by Pete Giles

events.description:
A one-of-a-kind yoga experience designed to awaken the senses, stir reflection, and bring you into deeper connection — followed by a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert.
Take this moment to become grounded in your true nature through embodied movement.
This practice is your invitation to appreciate and develop a deeper connection with the Earth — to slow down, to notice the changing landscapes and seasons around you, and to find them within you.
As you move through gentle hatha yoga, you’ll be surrounded by breathtaking visuals of our earthly home, designed and projected by Andy from Hype Entertainment.
Let us find our way back through nature, to our true nature and selves.

events.venue: 175 Vivian Street #Level 1 Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.description:
Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature A one-of-a-kind yoga experience designed to awaken the senses, stir reflection, and bring you into deeper connection — followed by a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert.
Take this moment to become grounded in your true nature through embodied movement.
This practice is your invitation to appreciate and develop a deeper connection with the Earth — to slow down, to notice the changing landscapes and seasons around you, and to find them within you.
We speak of “getting into nature” as something we have to do — yet Earth-based traditions have always seen the plant and all beings as interconnected and sacred, humans as one with the Earth itself.
Let us find our way back through nature, to our true nature and selves.

events.id: Taoism: How to Eat Wisely-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Taoism: How to Eat Wisely
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Taosim: How to Eat Wisely Discover the ancient wisdom of food, energy, and balance in this insightful session with Dr. Jinfeng — plus enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, included with your ticket.
Many people believe they’re eating healthily, yet still experience fatigue, inflammation, and discomfort.
Why is that?
In this workshop, you’ll explore food as medicine and gain insight into how to eat in a way that restores vitality, supports digestion, and balances your energy naturally.
What you’ll learn – The energetic qualities of different foods – How to identify which foods suit your constitution best – The ideal times to eat during the day and why timing matters – How TCM views food as fuel for both physical health and life force Whether you're curious about Eastern approaches to wellness or looking for practical tools to support your health, this workshop will offer a fresh and meaningful perspective on your relationship with food.

events.id: 2025 Peter Turner Lecture in Photography - Anne Noble-55 Cable Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: 2025 Peter Turner Lecture in Photography - Anne Noble
events.venue: 55 Cable Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.description:
Photography – The Art of Paying Attention In this lecture Anne Noble will discuss modes of collaborative practice across a series of projects that spans her work with bees as well as current projects concerning the environmental degradation of our waterways.
In 2023 Anne Noble was commissioned by Ngāi Tahu to create an archive of images that would reveal the deteriorating state of freshwater across South Island waterways and the resulting impact on mahinga kai customs and practices.
He is remembered for his passion for the medium, support of photographers and their work and his special love of practices he termed lyric, transcendent or poetic documentary photography.
In association with the Peter Turner Lecture a fund has been established by the Massey University Foundation to support the Peter Turner Scholarship that was launched in association with the lecture and each year provides a postgraduate student scholarship for a student engaging with social and cultural issues through the medium of photography in its broadest sense.
The Peter Turner Fund has been established by the Massey University Foundation to grow the support this scholarship can offer young photographers aspiring for a career the lens based arts.

events.description:
The Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet is thrilled to be performing at the WJC!
The two first played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Program under the mentorship of the legendary Rodger Fox, and now return to the stage for this special performance.
Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.
Each piece reflects moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher.
The set will also feature compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.

events.venue: Khandallah Town Hall, 11 Ganges Rd, Khandallah, Wellington 6035, New Zealand
events.description:
'It's in the Ballot' takes the format of the Kiwi TV classic 'It's in the Bag' game show and puts a political twist to it.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.

events.venue: 93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.description:
The Bitter Brothers are coming home!
After winding our way around the North Island in Holly Jean’s Estima, trailer in tow, from club to club in a jam-packed tour promoting our recent debut album, Daddy Was An Outlaw, we are very excited to bring it all back home and close off our tour full circle with a big party at the Voglemorn Upstairs!
We have some old favorites, some new numbers lined up for you all, and some very special surprise quests who you won’t want to miss.
And if you haven’t heard about us by now, The Bitter Brothers are a five-piece, Wellington based, southern gothic, old-time, alt-folk, alt-country musical experience.
They have banjos, accordions, violins, various guitars and voices, upright basses, drums, percussions, delightfully unexpected arrangements, tempos, and smile-inducing harmonies.

events.id: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour
events.venue: Meow, Wellington
events.description:
To celebrate the release of their sophomore album ‘The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)’ released via Flying Nun & Leather Jacket Records on June 27th, Tāmaki Makaurau post-punks Ringlets are embarking on a nationwide tour of Aotearoa this August.
Emerging from Aotearoa’s musical ether in 2021; Ringlets have carved out space with their distinct blend of delicate wit, grit and evident sonic technicality.
Since the release of their self-titled debut in 2023, the quartet have become a notorious live-act - supporting heavy-hitting internationals such as UK indie-rockers Sorry, seminal punk force The Damned, as well as stand-out festival performances at The Others Way, Newtown Festival & Junk Fest.
August 2025 marks the band’s first headline shows since 2023, with performances in Ōhinehou, Ōtepoti, Te Whanganui-a-Tara and Tāmaki Makaurau this August to celebrate the album.
The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) is Ringlets’ shimmering follow-up to the 2023 debut and a vibrant expression of their singular song craft - the record conjures mystic visions; takes raucous, unkempt yet solely committed turns, twists, and tiptoes delicately between the absurd and the divine.

events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.

events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
The Bitter Brothers are coming home!
After winding our way around the North Island in Holly Jean’s Estima, trailer in tow, from club to club in a jam-packed tour promoting our recent debut album, Daddy Was An Outlaw, we are very excited to bring it all back home and close off our tour full circle with a big party at the Voglemorn Upstairs!
We have some old favorites, some new numbers lined up for you all, and some very special surprise quests who you won’t want to miss.
And if you haven’t heard about us by now, The Bitter Brothers are a five-piece, Wellington based, southern gothic, old-time, alt-folk, alt-country musical experience.
They have banjos, accordions, violins, various guitars and voices, upright basses, drums, percussions, delightfully unexpected arrangements, tempos, and smile-inducing harmonies.

events.id: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) Album Release Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) Album Release Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
To celebrate the release of their sophomore album ‘The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)’ released via Flying Nun & Leather Jacket Records on June 27th, Tāmaki Makaurau post-punks Ringlets are embarking on a nationwide tour of Aotearoa this August.
Emerging from Aotearoa’s musical ether in 2021; Ringlets have carved out space with their distinct blend of delicate wit, grit and evident sonic technicality.
Since the release of their self-titled debut in 2023, the quartet have become a notorious live-act - supporting heavy-hitting internationals such as UK indie-rockers Sorry, seminal punk force The Damned, as well as stand-out festival performances at The Others Way, Newtown Festival & Junk Fest.
August 2025 marks the band’s first headline shows since 2023, with performances in Ōhinehou, Ōtepoti, Te Whanganui-a-Tara and Tāmaki Makaurau this August to celebrate the album.
The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) is Ringlets’ shimmering follow-up to the 2023 debut and a vibrant expression of their singular song craft - the record conjures mystic visions; takes raucous, unkempt yet solely committed turns, twists, and tiptoes delicately between the absurd and the divine.
