events.name: The Photonics / Class War On The Dance Floor / Meeps
events.venue: Pyramid Club, Wellington
events.description:
The Photonics is an optical sound project of Daniel Beban and Tim Barlow.
Taking a cue from early experiments in light and sound technology, various light emitting sources (including ultraviolet therapy torches, strobes, remote controls and regular LED and tungsten bulbs) are modulated into sound via solar panels, resulting in an immediate and direct transposition of the optical into the audible.
Sometimes dreamy, sometimes upbeat anti-capitalist anthems.
--- Meeps - Ambrosial explorations of Sound/Mind Theonomaspheres alongside analog synthesis and digital visual craftiness.
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.name: Padi Rescue Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
The Rescue Diver course is the perfect opportunity for you to develop your personal self-rescue dive skills, help tired divers, administer first aid and rescue distressed divers, under the guidance of your PADI Instructor.
The Rescue Diver will start you looking differently at diving, being more aware of the divers around you as well your own safety and dive gear.
PADI Rescue Diver Course Information: Digital Theory – PADI Rescue Diver eLearning or tablet course (about 11 hours) Full Weekend – Practical rescue skills and scenarios in the pool and open water Prerequisites: PADI Advanced Open Water Diver certification or Adventure Diver with Navigation (or qualifying certification from another agency) 12 Years of age or older What To Bring: Diver Medical | Participant Questionnaire (completed in the last 12 months).
Other languages – click here Your PADI Advanced Open Water Diver card or Adventure Diver with Navigation Your eLearning completion form First Aid & CPR certificate (can be taught in conjunction with the course) Swimming costume and towel, plus your dive gear.
Courses are normally once every 3 months through-out the year or by demand.

By the end of the course, you'll have had a basic introduction to using MS Excel, including how to: • Identify elements of a workbook • Page setup and printing • Enter and edit data and basic formatting • Generate basic calculations • Use cell references and built-in functions Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

Windows skills essential - this is not a course for absolute beginners to computing.
By the end of the course, you'll have had a basic introduction to using MS Excel, including how to: - Identify elements of a workbook - Page setup and printing - Enter and edit data and basic formatting - Generate basic calculations - Use cell references and built-in functions Presented by Lachman Prasad.

Scott Fitzgerald’s classic novel, which celebrates its 100th anniversary this year, we are seeking a cast of 12-14; a range of ages, mostly 20s-40s, with one 50+ male role, and two opportunities for singers (1M/1F) of any age who may also play other roles in the ensemble.
Set early in the Roaring Twenties, with its jazz music, gangsters, bootleg liquor, extravagance, and intractable social divides, the story sees Nick Carraway drawn into this decadent and hedonistic world and captivated by his mysterious neighbour Gatsby, until he is disillusioned by the events that unfold.
Auditions 9-10 August, with callbacks on 11 August.

events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

Then we move into works by people we’ve sung with, worked with, and deeply admire.
Our director Eric Sidoti brings a new arrangement of a song by Six60, adding a fresh and familiar note to the evening.
Thomas sang in the choir at a previous concert and has accompanied some of our rehearsals, and now we’re performing his Mass with the largest choir to present it to date.

These are works we believe in, and we can’t wait to share them with you.

events.id: The Photonics / Class War on the Dance Floor / Meeps-272 Taranaki Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Photonics / Class War on the Dance Floor / Meeps
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.description:
The Photonics is an optical sound project of Daniel Beban and Tim Barlow.
Taking a cue from early experiments in light and sound technology, various light emitting sources (including ultraviolet therapy torches, strobes, remote controls and regular LED and tungsten bulbs) are modulated into sound via solar panels, resulting in an immediate and direct transposition of the optical into the audible.
--- Class War on the Dance Floor is the solo project of Marika Pratley inspired by trance 80s synth pop and contemporary hip hop, using the Deluge.
Sometimes dreamy, sometimes upbeat anti-capitalist anthems.
--- Meeps - Ambrosial explorations of Sound/Mind Theonomaspheres alongside analog synthesis and digital visual craftiness.

events.description:
Cable Management brings you Unfolding, our debut gig where we couldn’t be more happy to share the sounds that move us—techno for your mind and body.
Expect evolving BPMs, genre hybrids, and a night that explores deep into the dark, hypnotic and underground.
It all started because we wanted to hear Eli Høff live—one of Aotearoa’s most exciting producers of deep, intricate and compelling techno, built for altered states.
Plus ikona happens to be dropping his latest EP soon and it all just came together.
We’re all about crisp, full-bodied sound, so we’ve teamed up with the legendary Tub’s Audio to deliver, backed by crystalline visuals from Vision Chips and Catalyst.

events.venue: Corner of Colombo & Rintoul Streets, Newtown, Wellington
events.description:
Take a pause.
Rest and Restore is a trauma-informed, inclusive workshop designed to support your nervous system through mindful movement, breathwork, and embodied self-compassion.
We’ll explore accessible somatic practices that tend to the physical, emotional, mental, and energetic layers of being.
Through grounding techniques, gentle yoga, restorative poses, and calming breathwork, you’ll be guided into a space of softness, regulation, and deep rest.
Come as you are.

Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique.
This is an excellent opportunity for a best friends' Sunday morning or a self-care session for yourself!
In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects.

events.id: The Voice That Mobilises Readers - Creative Writing Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Voice That Mobilises Readers - Creative Writing Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
A story runs through it -What is the voice that mobilises readers?
Research explains why certain forms of storytelling are especially effective at leaving readers with the desire to act on ideas.
If you want readers to walk with you into issues that are important to you, this is your chance to find out how.
Marilyn will share some evidence regarding effective voice and content, along with suggestions to apply the research.
You’ll read a few samples and have time to jot down and discuss your own starting points.

events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.description:
Craft an elegant twisted silver ring from solid silver!
Learn to soften and twist wire to create the twist you want, then how to form it up into a ring that fits you.
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.
An excellent, fun class if you have already taken one of our Stacking Rings or Textured Earrings classes and fancy adding to your jewellery collection.
Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
:-) Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!
Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools.
Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!
Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches.
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

events.name: Winter Textured Rings - Wellington
events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools.
Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!
Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches.
Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals.

events.name: Your Story, Your Way: Writing your life
events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
Everyone has a story worth telling — including you.
In this interactive workshop, you'll explore simple, engaging ways to begin writing your life story.
Whether you're looking to record memories for your family, reflect on your journey, or eventually publish a memoir, Gigi Fenster will help you take the first step.
No writing experience required — just bring your memories and a willingness to explore.
Limited places – secure your spot now!

events.id: Being in Print: Publishing Perspectives-289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Being in Print: Publishing Perspectives
events.venue: 289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
A panel discussing indie, professional and self publishing.
Traditionally published YA fantasy author Katharine J. Adams, self-published romance writer Leanna Morgan and indie-author Anne Ingram chat about their experiences in the publishing industry.
Learn why they chose to pursue their specific publishing pathway and the pros and cons of each.
Participants will gain insight to the different modes of the publishing industry – traditional, independent, self-publishing – and have the opportunity to ask questions.
Our thanks to NZSA Wellington Branch for sponsoring this event.

events.id: Queer Rangatahi Ruri Rongoā-Weka Road, Raumati Beach 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Queer Rangatahi Ruri Rongoā
events.venue: Weka Road, Raumati Beach 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
Ruri' is one word for a 'short love ditty, poem or jingle'.
Rongoā is most often understood as being healing or medicinal.
Ruri Rongoā is about being together, about connection with each other and in this case, having some fun with language itself.
At this session we'll spend time reading poems by awesome queer rangatahi, then we will write a couple ourselves -- one on our own, and one together as a group.
Suitable for ages 15-20.

events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.

events.venue: 59 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand
events.description:
Calling all rangatahi aged 13–18!
Join acclaimed poet and performer Te Kahu Rolleston for a dynamic 1.5-hour workshop where you’ll craft and perform your own powerful spoken word piece inspired by your connection to Kāpiti.
Explore your identity, voice, and creativity in a safe and supportive space—then take the stage and share your story with a live audience right after the workshop!
Whether you’re new to spoken word or already passionate about performance, this is your chance to be heard, be bold, and celebrate who you are.
This venue is accessible via stairs.

events.id: Wānanga - Mana Toi Mana Rangatahi-60 Lady Elizabeth Ln, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Wānanga - Mana Toi Mana Rangatahi
events.venue: 60 Lady Elizabeth Ln, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Nau mai haere mai, join us for a wānanga on what it means to be a young tangata whenua artist working and creating in Aotearoa.
Facilitated by Curator and Artist Israel Randell (Tainui, Ngāti Kahungunu, Rarotonga, Mangaia) who will be joined by ringatoi Aroha Matchitt-Millar (Ngāti Rangitihi, Te Whakatōhea, Tūhoe), Enjoy Curator Brooke Pou (Ngāpuhi, Ngāi Te Rangi) and Kiingi Tuheitia Portraiture Award 2025 winner Jazmin Tainui Mihi Paget-Knebel (Te Whānau-ā-Apanui, Whakatohea, Ngāpuhi, Ngāti Hine).
Together they will be discussing reclaiming art forms, their journeys as artists and curators, practical tips, and the importance of rangatahi artists in Aotearoa.
Poipoia te kākano kia puāwai.
This is a wānanga for rangatahi ringatoi at any stage of their harenga.

events.id: Wānanga - Mana Toi Mana Rangatahi-Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wānanga - Mana Toi Mana Rangatahi
events.venue: Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Facilitated by Curator and Artist Israel Randell who will be joined by ringatoi Aroha Matchitt-Millar, Enjoy Curator Brooke Pou and Kiingi Tuheitia Portraiture Award 2025 winner Jazmin Tainui Mihi Paget-Knebel.
This is a wānanga for rangatahi ringatoi at any stage of their harenga.
The intimacy of the process of skinning and pelting manu is both cathartic and repairing, recognizing the role colonisation had in separating Māori from these taonga while whatu-ing the strands of whakapapa back together.
Her toi centres the celebration of Māori and Indigenous cultures through the practice of decolonizing the lens and reclamation of visual narratives from an indigenous perspective.
There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue.

events.name: Where Does The Chocolate Come From? A World Building Workshop
events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
Bring your coloured pencils and join Katharine J. Adams to learn how world building can shape your story and vice versa.
Draw your own fantasy map, and create a believable fantasy world that readers (or TTRPGers) will fall into and never want to come out.
Topics include terrain, magic systems, civilisations and how they shape your magical new world.
Includes a Q&A with Katharine, author of the bestselling, NZCYA shortlisted, Witches of Halstett series.
Limited spaces - book now to secure your spot

events.id: High Tide: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick | Writers on Mondays-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: High Tide: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick | Writers on Mondays
events.venue: Wellington
events.description:
Seasoned Wellington writer Jenny Pattrick's latest novel, Sea Change, digs into the developing tensions within a small Kāpiti Coast community forced to negotiate a managed retreat after a rupture in the Alpine fault generates a devastating tsunami.
Tensions of a different kind propel debut author Jennifer Trevelyan's A Beautiful Family.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa.
The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow.
Admission is free and all are welcome.

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Seasoned Wellington writer Jenny Pattrick’s latest novel, Sea Change, digs into the developing tensions within a small Kāpiti Coast community forced to negotiate a managed retreat after a rupture in the Alpine fault generates a devastating tsunami.
Tensions of a different kind propel debut author Jennifer Trevelyan’s A Beautiful Family.
This suspenseful coming-of-age novel turns around a summer holiday on the coast and the search for a missing girl.
Two authors at different stages of their careers discuss their work with Kate Duignan.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

events.id: Next-Level BA: half-day workshop (Wellington)-2/318 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Next-Level BA: half-day workshop (Wellington)
events.venue: 2/318 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This is a course focused on a mindset shift (with the tools to back it up) to enable you to add more value as a BA.
As projects become more ambiguous and agile, the expectations on a BA are changing in a way gives us the opportunity to make a bigger impact - if we have the skills to take advantage... Workshop scope: 0.
If you are used to working ‘in’ projects but are ready to take more control in shaping them, then this is the perfect course for you!
What will you get out of the course?
You will walk out of this workshop with some genuinely practical skills to help put you in a leadership position within a project environment (shaping the approach, and course that the project takes).

events.id: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Hamilton-15 Turakina Rise, Rototuna North, Hamilton 3210-Humanitix
events.name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Hamilton
events.venue: 15 Turakina Rise, Rototuna North, Hamilton 3210
events.description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

events.name: Dynamic Planet: Screening + Panel Discussion
events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
"With restoration of the land, comes restoration of the people."
Goodlife Collective is proud to bring this screening of Dynamic Planet by Kiwi Producer Martha Jeffries to Tara-a-Whānganui Wellington, with the support of Commonsense Organics & Greater Wellington Regional Council.
Don't miss this rare opportunity to hear from the filmmaker herself, recently returned to New Zealand after 13 years in New York.
They reveal how science, nature, and traditional knowledge can prepare us for the future.
Comprised of four episodes: Earth, Water, Fire & Ice - we will be screening the 'Earth' episode.

events.id: Employment Essentials for Managers- Lambton Quay Wellington,-Event Brite
events.name: Employment Essentials for Managers
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington,
events.description:
This course will teach you how to build an effective team.
It covers the tools that are required to lead, plan, delegate and manage the workload of your team confidently.
You will also learn about your leadership style and how to motivate your team members to achieve targets and perform at a high level.
This one-day course would also suit team leaders who are keen to learn more about how to manage a team and get the best out of them.
Learning outcomes: Understand how to manage your time effectively and when delegating is appropriate for optimum team performance.

events.name: FREE Coffee and Trial
events.venue: Francis Street Blenheim, Marlborough Region
events.description:
Join us for a FREE barista-made coffee from our onsite cart and try one of the most discreet hearing aids of its kind —offering exceptional sound quality, all-day comfort, and the smallest design ever made by this manufacturer.
This advanced AI technology in the hearing aids is always on — continuously fine-tuning your listening experience in real time.
It works seamlessly in the background to ensure you get a more natural listening experience, no matter where you are.
Book your spot for August 12th from 10am to 1:30pm for our coffee and trial event —we’d love to meet you!

events.id: Work Smarter - Wairarapa. AI Literacy for Communications, Marketing and Business.-50 Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Work Smarter - Wairarapa. AI Literacy for Communications, Marketing and Business.
events.venue: 50 Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand
events.description:
You’ll learn: Why AI is suddenly everywhere - and why that matters for communications and marketing people.
Understanding AI so that you can apply it to the right tools for your role How to use AI for content creation, workflow, and strategy without devaluing human skillsets How to use AI critically, and understand the risks, red flags and ethics How to train AI to sound like you; so it reflects your brand, not generic outputs Step-by-step ways to save hours a week without cutting corners How to get your team onboard and start using AI safely and effectively Why early adopters are getting ahead fast, and how to future-proof your skills.
This workshop is built for: Marketing, communications and engagement professionals who want to retain value in our changing industry AI curious professionals and business owners Anyone who's been avoiding AI, and wants real, practical ways to use AI to improve marketing, communications and engagement right now.
You’ll walk away with: A practical understanding of AI, how it works and why it might not have been working for you already A toolkit of recommended AI tools tailored to your needs Clear workflows you can apply the next day Confidence to use AI without risking your brand, credibility or ethics The understanding of how to integrate AI into your work, team and organisation No tech jargon.
My focus is making AI accessible, ethical, and practical for people who don’t have time to waste - because knowledge is power, and understanding AI will make your job easier, not harder.

events.id: Return Season! The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing-25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Return Season! The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing
events.venue: 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Back after a sold-out season during the 2025 Wellington Pride Festival!
"She enthrals me, enslaves me – and her personal self – her body absolute – is my worship."
Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, and Vixen Temple present The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield’s Queer Writing, an immersive theatrical experience in one of Aotearoa’s leading historic house museums.
Join performance artist Vixen Temple and historian Kerryn Pollock of Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga on a journey through Mansfield’s sensual diary entries and sapphic-coded short stories, moving through the rooms in the home of her birth, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden in Thorndon.
Live musical accompaniment will be performed by Ms Weeds.

events.description:

Tables: If you would like to be manually invoiced or you would like to book a table of 8 people, please contact Wellington Chamber of Commerce to book this directly: events@wecc.org.nz Member tables: $760 + GST Non-member tables: $960 + GST Agenda: From 12.00pm - Guest arrival & networking 12.15pm - Guests seated for lunch 12.25pm - Mains served 12.55pm - Hon.

events.name: Bridget Douglas and Michael Tsalka - Flute and Piano
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
The program opens with J.S.
Internationally renowned visiting pianist, Michael Tsalka, showcases two solo works for piano: Pauline Viardot-Garcia’s charming Sérénade and Gavotte, followed by the World Premiere of Two Poems, One Meditation by British composer Prof. Nicholas Smith.
He has recorded 40 critically acclaimed CDs, with repertoire from the Baroque period to the Contemporary Era (including many world premiere recordings) for NAXOS, Grand Piano, Paladino, Brilliant Classics, IMI, Sheva Collection, Wirripang, Tempus Clasico, and Ljud & Bild.
Circa 85 contemporary compositions (which he premiered) were dedicated to him by composers from all over the world.
Bridget is Section Principal Flute of the NZSO and an Artist Teacher in Flute at the New Zealand School of Music - Te Kōkī.

events.id: Tales of the Unexpected - WELLINGTON-11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tales of the Unexpected - WELLINGTON
events.venue: 11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Professor Richard Beasley CNZM FRSNZ, the 2024 Rutherford Medal winner, will highlight ten influential research programmes that have challenged long-held clinical assumptions, advanced medical knowledge, and directly influenced patient care: Should fever be treated?
What was the cause of the epidemic of asthma deaths in New Zealand?
Biography Professor Richard Beasley, renown academic, physician, and researcher, is the founder and director of the Medical Research Institute of New Zealand (MRINZ).
Richard was Deputy Chair of the Health Research Council of New Zealand from 2010 to 2016 and has had a longstanding medical advisory role with the Asthma and Respiratory Foundation of New Zealand, chairing the adolescent and adult asthma guidelines group.
Richard was appointed a Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to medical research in 2008; elected a Fellow of the Royal Society Te Apārangi of New Zealand in 2015; awarded the Sir Charles Hercus Medal in 2016 in recognition of the impact of his research, the Beaven Medal in 2019 in recognition of his translational research, and was awarded the Rutherford Medal by the Royal Society Te Apārangi in 2024 for revolutionising the treatment of asthma worldwide.

The Wednesday performance will be followed by a Q&A session.
Born in Wellington, she lived permanently in England and Europe from 1908 until her untimely death from tuberculosis in 1923.
She became a central figure in literary modernism alongside contemporaries such as Virginia Woolf and DH Lawrence.

Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.

What's in-store: Join us and other Wellington business leaders for a practical and empowering evening of insights and networking.
You'll discover: · How the programme makes financial literacy accessible through educational content and free mentoring · What sets Know Your Numbers apart — and why it works · How your business or organisation can get involved and benefit right away Meet your speaker Tamara Somers - General Manager, Sustainability & Impact, Xero Tamara is a seasoned ESG leader and changemaker.

Happily Never After?
is a bold, original retelling of classic fairy tales—flipping the script on outdated stereotypes, exploring real teen issues, and reimagining what “happily ever after” really means.
This heartfelt and hilarious production tackles friendship, heartbreak, identity, and growing up, all through the lens of iconic characters like Ariel, Aladdin, Cinderella, and more.

events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Plus - there is an amazing plant-based dinner included in your ticket!
What to Expect Guided Elebreath session (conscious, rhythmic breathing and somatic presence) Embodiment practices to awaken sensory awareness and deepen body connection Intuitive visualization cues and energetic attunement Gentle music and sacred space to support emotional and energetic release Closing prompts for reflection and emotional integration You’ll be gently guided back into your own inner landscape—where truth lives, tension releases, and the nervous system finds a place to land.
Please consult a medical professional or get in contact if any of the following apply: Pregnancy (2nd or 3rd trimester especially) History of cardiovascular issues, stroke, or high blood pressure Epilepsy or severe respiratory conditions Diagnosed PTSD, schizophrenia, or other unmanaged mental health conditions Currently taking medications that affect heart rate or nervous system regulation All participants will be guided to listen to their body’s cues.
Your safety, sovereignty, and comfort come first.
We suggest: Drinking plenty of water Taking time to rest and reflect Journaling or voice noting any insights that arise Spending time in nature or grounding practices (e.g., bare feet on grass, epsom salt baths) Avoiding overstimulation or intense conversations immediately after Free Integration Resource Kit As part of your experience, you’ll receive access to a free post-session integration kit via my private Circle community, which includes: A grounding breathwork audio to support your nervous system reset A curated Spotify playlist for emotional flow Reflective journaling prompts to deepen embodiment and remembrance Meet Lynn, your host Lynn supports visionaries, wellness practitioners, and individuals navigating life transitions to return to the intelligence of their bodies — so they can live, lead, and create from a grounded, soul-aligned state.

events.id: Masterclass – Taumata Kōrero with Alexandre O. Philippe-Entrance D, Block Massey Unviersity, Wallace St Mount Cook, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Masterclass – Taumata Kōrero with Alexandre O. Philippe
events.venue: Entrance D, Block Massey Unviersity, Wallace St Mount Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Take a peek under the hood and get an inside look at the creative process as Swiss-American filmmaker Alexandre O. Philippe leads this special masterclass, with a focus on film history, deep analysis, and the art of cinematic storytelling.
Known for his distinctive approach to the cinema essay, including NZIFF 2025’s Chain Reactions Alexandre invites participants into a world where film is not just watched, but rigorously examined, deconstructed, and cherished.
A must-attend for filmmakers, critics, students, and film lovers alike, this masterclass promises to ignite your curiosity and sharpen your analytical eye.
Bring your questions, your obsessions, and your love for movies – this is cinephilia at its most alive and engaged.
Members of a number of Film Industry Guilds qualify for concession priced tickets to this Masterclass.

events.id: Lunchtime Concert: Ravel's L'Enfant et les Sortilèges (The Bewitched Child)-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Lunchtime Concert: Ravel's L'Enfant et les Sortilèges (The Bewitched Child)
events.venue: Wellington
events.description:
Join the Classical Voice students and the Collaborative Piano Class of NZSM with the senior choir Lyrica from Kelburn Normal Primary School in a magical journey.
We start in a bedroom where chairs and clocks come alive and cats,tea pots, and cups talk.
There's a Princess, a Fire who only warms the good, a little old man, a chorus of numbers, and all manner of birds, squirrels, frogs and talking trees teaching The Child empathy and compassion.
Children are welcome and will be encouraged to take part so please come dressed as your favourite animal or princess and let us tell you the story.

events.id: Leading by Learning, Wellington, August 2025- Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Leading by Learning, Wellington, August 2025
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Leading by Learning is both a theory and practice of effective, ethical educational leadership that enables you to make significant progress on the problems of practice that prevent you or your colleagues from achieving improvement goals.
Leading by Learning is the evolution of the seminal work of Argyris and Schön, whose 30-year research programme described why leaders struggled to create the organisational and interpersonal cultures that build trust, honesty, and collective commitment to solve important problems.
The course fee is $866 + GST per person.
This includes: the cost of the two-day workshop a one-year subscription to the Leading by Learning online hub (a value of $200!)
We are encouraging teams to attend these workshops.

events.venue: Floor 21, 171 Featherston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Discover Your Future in Finance Are you ready to launch your career in finance and gain insights from leading women shaping the industry?
This is your chance to hear their real stories, ask your burning questions, and grow your network.
What’s On 🔥 Fireside Panel Discussion: Hear from women who have built incredible careers in investment banking, strategy, wealth management, and asset management Taylor Brown – Director, Strategy, FirstCape Rebecca Drummond – Head of Advice, JBWere Dr Jenny Yang – Analyst, Harbour Asset Management From Investment Banking Analyst to Strategy Director, Taylor leads M&A projects and corporate strategy for one of NZ’s top financial services firms.
With nearly 20 years’ experience, Rebecca leads private wealth teams to deliver exceptional service and build trusted client relationships.
Moderated by: Vanessa Otang Wealth Adviser JBWere Women’s Wealth Keisha Wong – Co-Chair Victoria University of Wellington Finance & Investment Club Women in Business Why Attend?

events.description:

Find your favourite and grab a bottle to take home—perfect for gifting or continuing the magic later.
Whether you're a seasoned artist or picking up a brush for the first time, this relaxed, hands-on experience invites you to create under the spell of twilight tones and celestial charm.
As your artwork dries, indulge your senses with a chocolate tasting hosted by Elly from be happy chocolate.

events.id: It's the Little Websites that Count-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: It's the Little Websites that Count
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
For most current technology, it is assumed that the user is always online and has access to unlimited data.
But this assumption is only valid for regions with the infrastructure to support the internet.
As more vital communications and services transition into websites, how do we make sure that these services are still usable in areas with only low bandwidth internet or during natural disasters?
In this event we will start a discussion about developing smaller websites for accessibility in Aotearoa.
About the host Vic Roberts is a computer vision scientist who works with machine learning in medical imaging.

events.name: CLAY & BUBBLES Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
events.venue: Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio.
Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Unwind with a glass of bubbles as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece.
You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process.
Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.

events.id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Jake Baxendale-Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Jake Baxendale
events.venue: Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The eighth concert in our series is a new suite of music by local composer, performer, and wearer of excellent hats; Jake Baxendale.
For this concert, Jake is lifting his gaze from the domestic to the majestic with his new suite of music for improvisers, “Sky Meets Country”.
These new compositions utilise tools Jake developed for his Gardening Music ensemble: but where that music takes a granular approach to musical cells, simulating the inward posture of grubbing around in the earth, this new work expands outward to capture the feeling of vastness that open landscapes, bush canopies, and wide, blue skies can inspire.
Jake has written, performed, and recorded extensively over his career, including "Waypeople", a commission for the Wellington Jazz Festival in 2023, and releasing his latest album "Gardening Music" earlier this year.
Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

events.description:

Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone.

events.id: Explorers – The Age of Discovery - with James May-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Explorers – The Age of Discovery - with James May
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.description:
James May will premiere a landmark live theatre show in Australia, New Zealand and Singapore, bringing to life the stories of the extraordinary explorers who traversed the deserts, scaled the mountains, sailed into the unknown.
The live show combines theatrical techniques and James’ charismatic storytelling to create an evening of compelling intellectual entertainment.
From Ice Age migrations to space travel, the stories of famous, infamous and unknown explorers will come to life in a theatric style, presented by British television presenter and award-winning journalist James May.
James May is best known as a co-presenter of the motoring programs Top Gear and The Grand Tour, and as the host of the Our Man in… TV series.
Few endeavors have captured the imagination and spirit of humanity as profoundly as exploration.

events.venue: 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South
events.description:

Backed by her highly talented band, this team of musicians is more than just a show of music.
Some would say to witness them helps them gain a connection to their heart.
K A T E brings a presence to the room as her songs weave in and out of emotion and all of its duality that is tied to this life that we live as human beings.
K A T E's music offers joy and even sanctuary for all people wanting to enjoy the healing side that music can offer.

events.name: Ration the Queen's Veges
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No.
Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien.
ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood.
While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.

This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.

events.id: Corrella Skeletons Winter Tour - Wellington-Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook

events.venue: Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
After a massive summer of festivals and touring alongside L.A.B across Aotearoa and Australia, Corrella are hitting the road this August for their biggest headline tour yet — bringing their new album Skeletons to the stage for the very first time.
The album follows their breakout debut Road From 26, which featured the sleeper hit Blue Eyed Māori—a track that now holds the record for the most weeks ever spent at Number One on the NZ Singles Chart.
Since their debut, Corrella have sold out shows nationwide, become festival favourites, and picked up multiple Aotearoa Music Awards and Waiata Māori Music Awards.
This run of shows will be their biggest headline tour to date.
See Corrella live as they hit the road in August for their Skeletons Winter Tour taking on Auckland's Tuning Fork, Hamilton’s Factory, Wellington’s San Fran, Christchurch’s The Church & Dunedin’s Erricks, presented by Loop.

Fresh off her Aotearoa Music Award wins for Best Solo Artist and Album Of The Year, coupled with the release of her critically acclaimed album Soft Power & new single Motorway, Ōtautahi dream-pop artist Fazerdaze (Amelia Murray) is bringing her special duo show to Christchurch, Wellington, and Auckland.

events.id: Paperghost / Rara Sekar & Waterfalls (duo) / Hoof School-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Paperghost / Rara Sekar & Waterfalls (duo) / Hoof School
events.venue: Pyramid Club, Wellington
events.description:
Paperghost The musical project of the prolific artist & game developer, Zach Webber.
Inspired by cryptids, horror films & gadgets for sonic manipulation, he mixes live instruments, synths and samples to create intricate music that aims to immerse the listener in a curious space between the sublime, serene and dreadful.
--- Rara Sekar (multi-instrumental) & Waterfalls (flute) Rara Sekar (aka Hara) is an Indonesian singer-songwriter who blends inspiration from folk with Indonesian traditional music, cinematic pop, ambient and field recording.
Amber Johnson (aka Waterfalls) [Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Kahu ki Whangaroa] is a classically trained flautist with a thirst for pushing the flute's capabilities and the sonic possibilities inherent in expanded techniques and experimental music.
Her exploratory sensibilities meld with her love of harmony, modal music and the beauty of lush sounds.

events.id: Padi Advanced Open Water Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Padi Advanced Open Water Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
The AOW course is designed for both new and more experienced Open Water Divers and is best attended as soon after your Open Water Diver course as possible.
That way you will increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water; all under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
The AOW course consists of five dives that includes a: Deep and an Underwater Navigation dive.
Popular local options for the remaining three dives are: Peak Performance Buoyancy, Naturalist, Wreck, Fish Identification, Imaging, Night, *Enriched Air or *Dive Against Debris (* conditions apply).
This is the minimum requirement for our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.

events.name: Retirement Reinvented
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Whether you’re already retired, or planning ahead, this practical workshop will help you to reflect, re-envision and re-vitalise your life and develop a plan for your future, on your own terms.
(NZ citizen and residents free with ID, all others pay $109).
What’s next?
After the workshop, you’ll be able to identify a number of common issues and potential ways to manage them when considering and planning your “rejuvenation”, rather than a retirement.
By the end of the day, you’ll have: - Developed your own perspective on ageing and retirement in the 21st Century and identified what’s important to you - Completed a personal life audit exercise and considered your strengths - Explored possibilities in the major aspects of your life and identified potential challenges and strategies for overcoming them - Developed a blueprint to maximise the best years of your life and developed a “future proofing” downsizing plan - Considered options to include a sense of purpose and explored and implemented choices that provide you with that sense of purpose Bring a pen and paper.

Our local volunteer repairers will look at and try to fix all sorts of household gear: wooden, metal, electrical, electronic, pottery, computer, fabric, toys, clothing, beads, cardboard – as long as it’s small enough for you to bring.
One of our volunteers is a guitar repairer who can mend and tune any fretted instruments.
Another has an oilstone and will sharpen knives.
While you wait to have your item looked at, tea and coffee and cold drink are provided.

Romney, Corriedale cross Romney, Polwarth & Gotland sheep provide the fleeces to create fibre products for crafters which are sold via the Rewa Rewa Station website, and at Fibre Markets.

No scripts, no recordings – just real science, real stories, and your real questions.

events.id: Hands-on Sourdough Workshop- Gossey Drive North Wakefield, Tasman Region-Event Brite
events.name: Hands-on Sourdough Workshop
events.venue: Gossey Drive North Wakefield, Tasman Region
events.description:
This workshop is currently the only hands-on sourdough workshop being offered in the Nelson region - I teach and demonstrate to you and then you get to mix and practice on your own dough as we go along.
Then this is for you!
You'll go home with all you need to make a good loaf of sourdough bread: Knowledge Student Guide, including recipes and troubleshoot guide Bowl, liner, bowl scraper, and razor blade... all the tools you'd need to make sourdough Dough made in class to bake the next day at home, to wow your family/friends Confidence to continue the process yourself Healthy, bubbling starter to continue your journey at home Continued support and encouragement via our own private Facebook community group, for class attendees only Note: You will have your dough to take home after the workshop that will need shaping around 6-8pm, so please ensure that will work for you that day.Also, please double check the date when booking.
If for some reason you are unable to attend on the day, due to time constraints, I am unable to refund your ticket.
From feeling overwhelmed and giving up on the idea of ever making my own loaf of sourdough, to dancing with joy as i watch a beautiful perfect sourdough loaf get nice and golden in the homewood stove!The information was packaged in bite sizes with hands on practice in between, where we all got to experience each step of the whole process, which was cleverly condensed and prepared so that despite normally having waits in between, we were able to see it all play out in a short few hours!The process was beautifully organised with attention to detail that had us fawning, came away feeling so blessed and privileged!Sarah's glowing personality made all the information feel easy and palatable, it was so fun!Such a lovely time, great environment to learn with ease."

events.name: Discover Te Muna – Explore the Wines
events.venue: Craggy Range Te Muna Vineyard, 275 Te Muna Rd, Martinborough
events.description:
Born from passionate vignerons who embrace the challenge of extreme weather conditions, Te Muna Valley’s unique microclimate and soil structure produce exceptional wines with a distinctive style.
Join us for an interactive tasting led by wine writer and educator Joelle Thomson, as we explore a curated selection of Te Muna wines from a variety of producers.
You will be picked up from the Square in Martinborough and driven to the stunning Craggy Range Te Muna Estate vineyard, not normally open to the public.
Joelle will guide you through a tasting of twelve of Te Muna wines.
The experience concludes with a relaxed opportunity to revisit some of your favourites from the tasting and snack on some local products while meeting several of the producers, before being transported back to the Square.

events.venue: 1023 Longbush Road, Masterton
events.description:
Nestle into the warmth of the Longbush Cottage glasshouse for a mindful winter afternoon of watercolour nature journaling.
Surrounded by the subtle beauty of the winter garden, you’ll be guided to sketch and paint seasonal herbs like rosemary, thyme, and sage, learning techniques to capture detail and texture in your journal.
This peaceful session is perfect for slowing down and reconnecting with nature through art.
Sip on bubbles and savour warm rosemary focaccia with herb-infused oil as you work.
No experience required- just bring a curious eye and a love of seasonal beauty.

Hihi & The Stitchbirds are: Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes Chris Goldsbury - guitar, clarinet and vocals Tess Luff - guitar, banjo uke and vocals Matt Hutton - bass uke and vocals Ellie Stewart - fiddle and vocals About the Bidibids: With lush harmonies, intricate arrangements, and beguiling melodies, the Bidibids explore what it means to play folk music in New Zealand.
The Bidibids are Sarah August on banjo and guitar, Simon Carryer on cello-banjo, and Brendan Schenk on mandolin and guitar.

7:00pm - Doors 7:30pm - The Bidibids 8:30pm - Hihi & The Stitchbirds After a whirlwind 18 months as a five-piece folk band, Hihi & The Stitchbirds are delighted to release their debut EP with five original songs that will make you feel soothed and seen.
They will be joined on stage by their friends the Bidibids.
Pairing rich vocal harmonies with vibrant original music inspired by the folk and Americana playbooks, this band brings something for everyone.
Hihi & The Stitchbirds are: Elena Saunders - vocals and vibes Chris Goldsbury - guitar, clarinet and vocals Tess Luff - guitar, banjo uke and vocals Matt Hutton - bass uke and vocals Ellie Stewart - fiddle and vocals About the Bidibids: With lush harmonies, intricate arrangements, and beguiling melodies, the Bidibids explore what it means to play folk music in New Zealand.
The Bidibids are Sarah August on banjo and guitar, Simon Carryer on cello-banjo, and Brendan Schenk on mandolin and guitar.

events.name: Sue Dyson - Welcome To Our Lounge
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Welcome To Our Lounge Tour - Featuring songs from Linda Ronstadt & Carole King Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 16 August 2025 Sue Dyson, a gifted vocalist known for her warm and captivating stage presence, backed by talented pianist Mitch Dean to offer an extraordinary musical experience that celebrates the enduring legacies of Linda Ronstadt and Carole King.
Set in Hilltop's laid-back intimate atmosphere, their performances promise an engaging experience where the audience will tap their feet to the classics that have defined generations.
Additionally, Sue has lent her voice as a backup vocalist at the prestigious New Zealand Music Awards and has enjoyed significant success with her original country music in Australia.
Notably, he played keys and guitar in the acclaimed Wellington Fleetwood Mac Experience, contributing to their successful tour.
Mitch’s deep understanding of music, combined with his skillful instrumentation, enriches the duo's sound and enhances the overall performance.

Released in 1977, the album defined a disco generation.
Special guests Debora McLane (niece of the Bee Gees) and Roslyn Loxton join the tribute band on stage.
The album ‘Saturday Night Fever’ was the biggest-selling sound recording between 1977 and 1980.

events.id: Orangefarm and Warm Regards-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Orangefarm and Warm Regards
events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
Orangefarm and Warm Regards Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs.
Warm Regards is a band that epitomizes style, comfort, economy, and power — a sleek sedan equally at home on the racetrack or with the family bundled safely in the back.
Blending indie rock, pop, folk, and jazz-country flair, their infectious sound and high-energy performances have earned them a dedicated local following.
With frontman Tom Watson (Cassette, Terror of the Deep, HLAH) leading the charge, Warm Regards deliver introspective lyrics, tight grooves, and lush harmonies that promise an unforgettable live experience.
Orangefarm brings a distinct mix of shimmering guitars, melodic hooks, and lyrical wit that’s become their signature sound.

events.name: Paperghost / hara & Waterfalls (duo) / Hoof School
events.venue: 272 Taranaki St, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Paperghost The musical project of the prolific artist & game developer, Zach Webber.
Inspired by cryptids, horror films & gadgets for sonic manipulation, he mixes live instruments, synths and samples to create intricate music that aims to immerse the listener in a curious space between the sublime, serene and dreadful.
- hara (multi-instrumental) & Waterfalls (flute) hara is the solo project of Indonesian singer-songwriter Rara Sekar.
Her music weaves together folk, Indonesian traditional music, cinematic pop, ambient, and field recordings, while centering on themes of ecology, vulnerability, grief, and politics.
Amber Johnson (aka Waterfalls) [Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Kahu ki Whangaroa] is a classically trained flautist with a thirst for pushing the flute's capabilities and the sonic possibilities inherent in expanded techniques and experimental music.

events.id: Fareham Journey Free Information Tour-Fareham Gallery, 80 Underhill Road,, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Fareham Journey Free Information Tour
events.venue: Fareham Gallery, 80 Underhill Road,, Featherston
events.description:
Fareham Journey is building a sustainable cohousing community in Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston and they are looking for people who share their kaupapa to create this with us.
The Fareham property has extensive grounds which include a historic homestead, farmland, established organic gardens and an orchard, old school buildings, a swimming pool, and an arts community on site.
We run these free information and tour events on the third Sunday of every month, from noon until 2pm at Fareham, 80 Underhill Road, Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston.
Learn about the Fareham Journey and our vision to create a sustainable and supportive community and how you can get involved.
We invite you to bring a plate of vegetarian food to join us for a shared meal in the historic homestead, Fareham House, followed by the tour.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - Horizons RC - Tonga Māori Constituency-In-studio- The Square Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - Horizons RC - Tonga Māori Constituency-In-studio
events.venue: The Square Palmerston North, Manawatu-Wanganui
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Hataitai Community Centre, warmly extends an invitation for you to Experience the joy of learning and refreshing your knowledge of flax weaving.
• New participants should bring 5-10 rau (blades) of harakeke, a sharp pair of scissors, an old towel, and a bag for any unused rau.
• Returning participants should bring 30-40 rau (blades) of harakeke along with their tools.
A Koha (donation) is appreciated to the centre, but it is not a requirement for participation.
Come and enjoy the weaving experience while connecting with the rich tradition of Māori arts and crafts.

events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
events.description:
Roussel "The Spider’s Feast: Symphonic Fragments" Saint-Saëns "Carnival of the Animals" It’s a bug’s life in Roussel’s "The Spider’s Feast", a suite depicting the insects found in a garden.
This special performance moves from the garden to the Aotearoa New Zealand native bush with Giant Wetas, Huhu Grubs and all the fluttering life found in the forest.
One thing is always clear, the spider is always looking for lunch.
This work is guaranteed to make the kids laugh, smile, and squirm!
We also welcome Oscar-winning songwriter and funny man Bret McKenzie.

events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
GRACE A Prayer For Peace asks big, bold questions about art, community, and the human spirit.
A film of beauty and conviction, GRACE — A Prayer for Peace journeys through Aotearoa, Kiribati, and Japan in search of meaning, memory, and peace.
Born from dialogue between two great Dames — Gaylene Preston and Robin White — this is a prayer told in images, art, and truth.
Join us for a Q&A afterwards from the Dames themselves: Dame Gaylene Preston and Dame Robin White.

events.name: Ghost Trio (piano trio)
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Monique Lapins (violin), Ken Ichinose (cello) and Gabriela Glapska (piano).
The programme is titled “Between Tides” based upon the concept of a journey through time and cultural landscapes, showcasing the evolution of chamber music from the late 18th century (Beethoven) to the 20th century (Shostakovich), and finally to the contemporary era (Takemitsu, Downie).
There is a world premiere of a work by New Zealand’s own Glen Downie, written especially for the Ghost Trio.
Ludwig van Beethoven, Piano Trio in D major Op 70 No.
2 in E minor Op 67

events.id: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour-Old St Paul's, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour
events.venue: Old St Paul's, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington
events.description:
"Presented by Strung Out Touring Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour After opening for Kasey Chambers around Australia, award-winning songwriter Jenny Mitchell returns home for a national tour celebrating her acclaimed album Forest House.
Now based in Melbourne, the AU Review describes Jenny’s music as a “sublime slice of folk” and her new highly anticipated album, Forest House, is capturing fans across the motu and the globe.
- Old St Paul's - Sunday 18 August - Doors open at 7pm - Support from Katie Thompson NZ Best Country Artist Winner and 2 x Golden Guitar nominee, Jenny Mitchell, is a storyteller from the deep south of New Zealand with impactful songs full of grace and grit.
Her last album ‘Tug of War’ included the pivotal release of the 2022 APRA NZ Best Country Song ‘Trouble Finds a Girl’ and was described by Rolling Stone as an album, “worthy of every award it will inevitably collect.” No stranger to the road, Jenny was recently awarded a scholarship to perform at Nashville’s iconic AmericanaFest and has toured Australia and New Zealand extensively over the last decade - supporting artists including Fanny Lumsden (AU), Tami Neilson (NZ) and Nadia Reid (NZ) along the way.

events.venue: Acacia Avenue Upper Riccarton Christchurch,
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems 2024-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems 2024
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Join editor and poet Nick Ascroft as he introduces a crackling selection of New Zealand poets from his edition of the annual online anthology Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems.
James Brown, Robin Peace, Simon Sweetman, Stacey Teague, Philomena Johnson, Kiri Piahana-Wong, Zephyr Zhang, and others will read their work, and poems by the late Fleur Adcock, Vincent O’Sullivan, and Paula Harris will also be celebrated in this warm-up to Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day.

events.id: Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions-1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions
events.venue: 1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand
events.description:
Doctors For Nutrition and MTM Charity invite you to an evening of inspiration, education, and connection at our next ‘Dine with a Doc’ dinner.
Join us for a presentation on ‘The Power of Plant-Based Nutrition and Lifestyle Interventions for Preventing Chronic Disease’—an event designed to empower everyone from healthcare professionals to health-conscious community members.
You will also be the first to hear about the new MTM charity, and about their mission.
Through easy-to-understand explanations of key concepts - such as endothelial dysfunction, intramyocellular lipid accumulation, and calorie density - you’ll discover how WFPB eating can dramatically improve health outcomes and transform lives.
After the presentation, join us for a panel discussion and a Q&A session with Dr Haitjema and Dr Luke Wilson.

events.name: Structured literacy approaches, years 0-8, Wellington 2025
events.venue: . Wellington, Wellington .
events.description:
Empower your school with structured literacy approaches – PLD for years 0-8 Join us for professional learning and development (PLD) designed to help schools implement evidence-based structured literacy approaches across Years 0-8.
Our expert facilitators work alongside teachers and school leaders to strengthen literacy instruction, ensuring every learner develops the skills to succeed.
✔ Implement a clear, systematic, and cumulative approach to literacy.
✔ Strengthen decoding, fluency, comprehension, and writing instruction.
✔ Support learners who need additional scaffolding and intervention.

events.id: Targeted and tailored structured literacy approaches - Wellington-. Wellington, Wellington Region .-Event Brite
events.name: Targeted and tailored structured literacy approaches - Wellington
events.venue: . Wellington, Wellington Region .
events.description:
Tāwhirihia is a fully funded, year-long professional learning opportunity for the one teacher in each school, with the staffing entitlement to lead targeted and tailored support.
If that’s you, this course will deepen your expertise in structured literacy approaches and equip you to make a measurable difference for students in Years 0–2 who need it most.
You’ll build, apply, and refine your practice through three integrated strands: Te Hau Mātea – Five full-day, in-person workshops to build deep knowledge and practical tools Day One and Two: 19th and 20th August Day Three and Four: 4th and 5th November Day Five: 25th November Te Hau Piritahi – Five short online sessions to reinforce strategies and share insights with peers Te Hau Arotahi – Small-group coaching to apply learning in context, adapt instruction, and stay on track.
A 60 min online introductory session will be held preceding the first day - date TBC Each strand builds on the last — helping you turn evidence into action, and action into impact.
NB; The MOE fund one teacher per school.

events.id: Draw It Out Block Course for Parents of Neurodivergent Children-Draw It Out studio, Level 2, 105 High street, Lower Hutt, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Draw It Out Block Course for Parents of Neurodivergent Children
events.venue: Draw It Out studio, Level 2, 105 High street, Lower Hutt, Lower Hutt
events.description:
A unique space to support those who are supporting others.
Parenting can often feel isolating yet many are going through similar journeys.
Dates This block course consists of 4 workshops: 10.30am-11.45am Tuesday 19th August – Re-finding yourself Tuesday 26th August – Caring for your needs Tuesday 2nd September - Self-compassion Tuesday 9th September – Seeing potential Cost $46 per session, $184 total Included in each session You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance.
No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.

events.id: The Parliamentary Launch of the NZCBIA Building Construction Report-Legislative Council Chamber - NZ Parliament, 1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Parliamentary Launch of the NZCBIA Building Construction Report
events.venue: Legislative Council Chamber - NZ Parliament, 1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington
events.description:
The NZCBIA Building Construction Report, commissioned by the New Zealand Chinese Building Industry Association (NZCBIA) and led by renowned economist Shamubeel Eaqub, is fast becoming a respected voice in New Zealand’s property and construction sectors.
This year’s edition provides practical insights into key industry issues, with a particular focus on people, including workforce trends, productivity, training and upskilling, diversity, and the growing impact of AI.
Backed by data and real-world case studies, the report sheds light on the challenges and opportunities shaping the future of the sector.
The Parliamentary Launch brings together industry leaders, government representatives, and key stakeholders to mark the release of this influential report and to drive conversations that support the sustainable development of New Zealand’s building and construction industry.

events.name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
Meet your host, Sivananda Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass.
His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle.
Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.

events.description:
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point?
This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
Meet your host, Sivananda Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass.

Will you be in the room?

ConCOVE has been at the forefront of research and innovation in vocational education, and this flagship event is our opportunity to share the latest research and the steps you can take to create change where it matters the most: in workplaces, training providers, and policy development.

events.description:
Wellington City Chorus is a group of dedicated and talented women (and one man) who perform one of the few musical art forms that originate in the United States - Barbershop Harmony.
Wellington City Chorus is a chapter of Sweet Adelines International.
This non-profit organisation is dedicated to teaching, learning and singing four-part harmony, barbershop style, through performances and teaching, perpetuating and creating a love for this style of A Cappella singing in our community.
Wellington City Chorus is fortunate to have David Brooks as our Director – skilled in and enjoys the craft of barbershop and willingly passes on his knowledge.
As previous national champions Wellington City Chorus has represented New Zealand on the international stage in Las Vegas, Hawaii, Denver, Baltimore and St Louis.

Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
Because this is a reminder that politics isn't just about policies and power plays - it's about stories, people and the laughs that come with it.
Whether you're a political junkie, or just dipping your toes into current affairs, Three Gals One Beehive invites you to pull up a chair, pour a glass of wine and join the conversation that's as enlightening as it is entertaining: Whether it's recounting drama that’s reminiscent of a House of Cards episode or assessing the strategic manoeuvres that would be at home in The Queen’s Gambit, their podcast promises to make even the driest political topics engaging.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.

events.id: (Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down-Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: (Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down
events.venue: Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate.
He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music.

events.description:
Perspectives on Aroreretini | ADHD Join us on August 20 at 6:00pm for an insightful discussion on ADHD (Aroreretini) from a range of expert voices.
Whether you're a parent, educator, clinician, someone with ADHD, or simply interested in learning more, this event is for you!
The panel will explore how ADHD is understood and supported in Aotearoa, including myths and misconceptions, debates in the field, and potential ways forward.
We have assembled a panel who represent different areas of research, practice, and lived experience of ADHD.
We will have time for patai (questions) from attendees, followed by time to eat and connect with others.

Nau mai, haere mai, hoki mai.
Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum is proud to present the Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, an informative lecture series about the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of the Waitangi Tribunal held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
The review is part of the coalition agreement between New Zealand First and National and will be led by an Independent Technical Advisory Group (ITAG), supported by Te Puni Kōkiri, to examine the whether the Waitangi Tribunal is “fit for purpose, not just for today, but for the generations to come.” Joining us to discuss the topic of reform are Former Attorney-General and Treaty Minister Christopher Finlayson, and Matanuku Mahuika, who co-chaired the Waitangi Tribunal’s own Strategic Direction Review Group in 2024.
Tickets are $35 per session, or $25 for students and SuperGold Card holders, and include one drink and light kai.
Christopher Finlayson served as an MP for 12 years, including as Attorney-General and Minister for Treaty of Waitangi Negotiations from 2008 to 2017.

The review is part of the coalition agreement between New Zealand First and National and will be led by an Independent Technical Advisory Group (ITAG), supported by Te Puni Kōkiri, to examine the whether the Waitangi Tribunal is “fit for purpose, not just for today, but for the generations to come.” Joining us to discuss the topic of reform are Former Attorney-General and Treaty Minister Christopher Finlayson, and Matanuku Mahuika, who co-chaired the Waitangi Tribunal’s own Strategic Direction Review Group in 2024.

events.id: Conservation Kōrero: Underwater Forests of Wellington-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Conservation Kōrero: Underwater Forests of Wellington
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.description:
Towering seaweed forests and colourful sponge gardens lie just beneath the surface of Wellington’s coastline.
Like forests on land, these underwater habitats support a remarkable diversity of life, including treasured kaimoana species.
Yet they face growing pressure from human activity and environmental change.
Dr Nicole Miller will take us on a visual journey through Wellington’s Blue Belt, exploring current conservation successes and challenges.
Drawing on years of diving, photography and local restoration work, Nicole will highlight the beauty and fragility of these ecosystems and why it’s more important than ever to bring changes to the surface.

events.id: Redacted- Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Redacted
events.venue: Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
An exciting and immersive original production, Redacted is a bold devised theatre work created entirely by the Year 2 and 3 drama students.
Bursting with energy and imagination, this vibrant piece blends dance, dialogue, monologue, music, and abstract art to explore the current state of Wellington, the arts, and the shifting world around us.
Through a series of compelling vignettes and live art moments, the students reflect on their place within the arts landscape today, diving into themes of the universe, taonga, Superman, and freedom of speech.
Honest, dynamic, and deeply creative, Redacted showcases the extraordinary voices of tomorrow’s artists as they grapple with what it means to express themselves in a constantly evolving world.
Directed by Lyndee-Jane Rutherford and Gavin Rutherford

In this gentle, guided workshop, we’ll explore simple yet powerful art-based mindfulness practices designed to help you slow down, reconnect with yourself, and find presence through making.
Using a mix of mark-making, colour exploration, and intuitive drawing, you’ll be encouraged to let go of outcomes and tune into the process—no pressure, no perfection, just peaceful creativity.
This special locals’ offering is a small thank you to those who continue to support Ventana and value the power of art to soothe and restore.

events.description:
You don’t feel you’ve the right to pursue your dreams You don’t have the confidence to speak up and share ideas You’d love to dress differently but you’re scared what people will say.
You’re doing what’s expected of you, but it feels like you’re leading someone else’s life.
This workshop is for you If lack of confidence is holding you back If you’re struggling with leadership If you’ve been told you’re too much What we'll cover in the workshop Build a foundation that’ll empower you to take risks, overcome fear and self-doubt, and do the things you’ve always wanted to do.
A fun day of laughter and connection for anyone who wants to explore how they can take up more space in the world.
Meet your irreverent badass hosts Miraka (Shelly) Davies Described as the lovechild of Brené Brown and P!nk, aged 37, Shelly walked away from her family’s five-generation commitment to conservative Christianity and started the exploratory period of her life, also known as “fucking shit up.” A people pleaser in recovery, she infiltrates organisations on the pretext of giving writing training and subverts teams to question the rules, while using her hard-won lessons in badassery to inspire you to know yourself, love yourself, find power, and have joy.
