events.name: Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact Whether you are just starting out or already running a business, having an online and social media presence is essential.
While most of us know in theory that we need a marketing plan, a social media strategy, a consistent post schedule, and engaging reels for TikTok, the reality is that every business is unique, and your approach should reflect that.
With attention spans shorter than ever, your audience will move on within seconds if they are not engaged—they see images first and then only start reading the text.
In this course, we will explore different types of content suitable for your specific needs and audiences, how to create it or where to source it, how to develop the right visual strategy for your online presence, what tools to use, and how to implement it immediately.
By the end of the course, you will have an outstanding online presence.

events.description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.
Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!
In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others.
This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.
You will discover: what stops you from saying "no" when you really want to how to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no" how to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC).

events.venue: Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Reiki Infused Sound Healing Sink into a meditative sanctuary of stillness with Nizaad — a healing energy practitioner and space holder rooted in ancestral wisdom, sound, and ceremony.
Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert after the event - all included in your ticket!
Held in a Reiki-activated field, it invites you to rest the body, quiet the mind, and shift brainwaves into a deeply relaxed state, supporting nervous system regulation and emotional balance.

events.id: Saluti e baci! A Taste of Sicily-Tonic Bistro, 8 Kitchener Street, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Saluti e baci! A Taste of Sicily
events.venue: Tonic Bistro, 8 Kitchener Street, Martinborough
events.description:
An evening of Sicilian wine and tapas with Tonic and Lucas Monge of Del Mundo Imports.
Since 1851, five generations of the Rallo family have produced some of Sicily’s finest wines at their Donnfugata winery.
In recent years they have innovated winemaking and sustainability practices on the island while showcasing traditional varietals such as Nero D’Avola, Grillo and Zebibbo.
Join Tonic and Del Mundo’s Lucas Monge for an exploration of Sicily via wine and antipasti/dessert pairings.
Thursday, 21 August, 6:30pm Registration via Tonic’s website.

events.name: Sachi | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
One of New Zealand's most celebrated live acts, dance music duo SACHI have today announced two shows across Pōneke and Tāmaki Makaurau.
Tickets for SACHI’s shows in Wellington and Auckland will be available to purchase by the General Public on Tuesday, July 15 at 12pm local time.
My Live Nation members will also be able to secure tickets during the presale which commences on Monday, July 14 at 1pm until Tuesday, July 15 at 11am local time.
Fans can register for access at livenation.co.nz.
Each of the EPs’ title characters represents a different phase of SACHI’s discography — from their introduction on Lunch With Bianca, to establishing themselves internationally on Nights With Ruby (created while living in LA pre-pandemic), to the full-circle evolution of their most refined and lustrous body of work to date, Breakfast With Ella.

events.venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Way back in January 2023, Jake, Dan and Mark formed an instant rapport on the bandstand of a garden party.
With a nod to famous saxophone trios such as the Sonny Rollins band of A Night at the Village Vanguard and Lee Konitz' Motion, The Wedding Trio reinterprets classic jazz standards and original compositions by Jake Baxendale, utilising the space afforded by the absence of a chordal instrument to investigate groove, polyphony and interaction, all in the spirit of freewheeling, rambunctious fun that any good wedding party will conjure up!

events.id: Textiles and Queerness in a NZ Film! Went Up The Hill at NZIFF Wellington-10 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Textiles and Queerness in a NZ Film! Went Up The Hill at NZIFF Wellington
events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Hi queer friends who love crafts-have I got the film for you!
NZ feature film Went Up The Hill will have its Wellington Premiere at the NZ International Film Festival on 21 August at the Embassy at 830pm-get your ticket now!
Come along and be amongst the first to see NZ feature film Went Up The Hill from queer NZ filmmaker Sam Van Grinsven.
The film premiered to critical acclaim as a Special Presentation at Toronto Film Festival in 2024 where Sam was hailed by Hollywood Reporter as already having the ‘control of a master’ in a film that is ‘captivating', ‘elliptical' and 'technically stunning’.
Sam Van Grinsven has a passion for queer interpretation of genre and seeing queer characters within spaces that historically have not been explored as diversely.

events.name: LHPC Antenatal Class 8 2025
events.venue: 12 Britannia Street Lower Hutt, Wellington 5012
events.description:
Lower Hutt Parents Centre ispart of a national voluntary-led, not-for-profit organisation who provide high quality ChildbirthEducation Classes (Antenatal Classes), Baby & You Classes and other Parent EducationClasses for Hutt Valley families.
We are here to help.
Our comprehensive Antenatal Classes lead by qualified Childbirth Educators will help you prepare for labour, birth and the early days with a newborn.
From time to time a 'weekend intensive' course which runs for two full days is held on consecutive Saturdays.
Courses cost $220 (including booking fee) The course covers: • Nutrition and exercise during pregnancy • Labour signs and stagesWe • Pain relief options and interventions • The birth process • Breastfeeding and newborn care • Transition to Parenthood and practical parenting • A tour of Hutt Hospital maternity unit, either physical or virtual tour We encourage you to enrol early to ensure you get a spot.

events.id: 2025 Big Breakfast & Charity Auction for Big Brothers Big Sisters-42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2025 Big Breakfast & Charity Auction for Big Brothers Big Sisters
events.venue: 42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.description:
Join Big Brothers Big Sisters of Wellington and Guest Speaker Glen Denham on Friday 22 August at the Petone Club, Udy Street, Petone for a delicious buffet breakfast, exciting live auction, raffles and more!
Glen Denham is the Principal of Wellington College, where he channels his lifelong passion for teaching and school leadership.
Before transitioning into teaching, Glen was a national basketball player, earning a spot as a Tall Black for 16 years during the 1980s and 1990s.
As team captain for 13 of those years, he was regarded as one of New Zealand’s top players and a key figure in the country's basketball legacy.
His journey from professional athlete to educator has shaped his dynamic leadership style, blending discipline, resilience, and teamwork with a deep commitment to nurturing youth.

events.id: Threads & Treasures: Indigo Workshop + Market-Thunderpants HQ, 42 Naples St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Threads & Treasures: Indigo Workshop + Market
events.venue: Thunderpants HQ, 42 Naples St, Martinborough
events.description:
Craft and recycle market including a drop in indigo dying business and other potential fabric design.
www.thunderpants.co.nz/ We’re a small, ethical, family-owned and operated company, based in the Wairarapa, producing New Zealand made cheeky goodness for your bum (and other areas) from regeneratively grown Australian cotton.
The Thunderpants story began in Nelson in 1995, when we were design students frustrated by irritating undies.
The challenge was on to create the ultimate comfy undie that wouldn’t go up your bum… Now, twenty years on, Thunderpants has grown to produce nearly 50,000 Thunderpants garments a year including kids clothes, swimwear, yoga pants, leggings, tops and camis.
Our focus has always been on producing underwear and clothing of exceptional quality and design using fun colourful prints and this ethos permeates all aspects of the clothing we produce.

events.venue: 110a Cuba Mall, Wellington
events.description:
Join us for a hands-on floral workshop where nature, creativity, and intentional design come together.
Led by Jade — a floral designer with a background in natural health — you’ll learn how to create a garden-style hand-tied bouquet using seasonal blooms and healing herbs.
We’ll explore bouquet-building techniques, flower symbolism, and how to work with nature’s rhythms in your design process.
No prior experience needed — just bring your curiosity and love for flowers.

events.venue: Hutt Art Society, 9-11 Myrtle St, Lower Hutt
events.description:
Description: Learn how to do 'One Stitch Sashiko' and turn your stitching into a Komebukuro bag (rice bag).
Participants will explore a range of different one stitch sashiko stitches in class then complete the panels at home ready to return and complete the bag construction in a second class.

Wooden bowls for the pin cushion will be available to buy in class.

events.name: A Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
In this 60-minute downhill walk we will enjoy one of the legacies of Wellington’s previous summers, namely the large ‘smorgasbord’ of woody fruit structures.
A close-up look at these structures will reveal a wide variety of mechanisms for fruit formation, protection, and dispersal.
Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn Cost: $5 (cash only, please).
or free for Friends.
This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Our final concert will celebrate our rich and active history, drawing on much-loved favourites, and some new songs, that show off the unique qualities of male voice harmony.

events.id: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga August 23rd of August-28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga August 23rd of August
events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.
Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years.
He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer.

events.venue: level 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (and live events a few times per week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
It is a joy to make community contemporary radio !
This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull.
THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling each other.

events.id: The English Locust & Antü Mãrama Play The Shed-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The English Locust & Antü Mãrama Play The Shed
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
The English Locust is the folk/blues solo project of Wellington musician Jim Bailey.
The English Locust describes his sound as " Bob Dylan if he was goth", fusing the melancholy poeticism of groups like the Smiths and Joy Division with the musical stylings of folk and Delta Blues.
With his solo project The English Locust, he was a regional finalist in this years Battle of the bands, being the only soloist to make it that far in this years competition.
The group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mabudungun word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.
Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.

One of New Zealand's most celebrated live acts, dance music duo SACHI have announced two shows across Pōneke and Tāmaki Makaurau.
Dominating festivals not only in New Zealand but around the world, their success has even seen the pair become the first New Zealand act to play at Belgium’s Tomorrowland festival — one of the most prestigious electronic music festivals in the world.

events.name: The Shake-'Ems | Rogue & Vagabond
events.venue: 18 Garrett St, Wellington
events.description:
From amidst the wreckage of our capitalist wasteland they rise, like a phoenix soaring through a bowl of molasses...
The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money.
Middle New Zealand's favourite dadaist swing cult phenomenon are back with a vengeance, serving up a fiery primordial soup of fresh tunes for your listening and dancing 'pleasure'.
Prepare for the stupidest gags, hottest horn solos, stonkiest grooves and pea-brained banter as we reign supreme in the battle of wits and people's attention against the existential crisis rectangle, otherwise know as the iPhone.
Don't miss this exuberant show, or you may regret it for the rest of your miserable life.

events.name: Bitch Stole My Brand - A Rotten Drag Show
events.venue: Ivy Bar and Cabaret, 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Get ready for a night of shade, sequins, and sheer disrespect.
Wellington’s finest (and pettiest) drag artists are coming together for the messiest, most unoriginal concept yet — each queen is stealing another queen's look and absolutely ruining it.
It's a roast!
It's the chaotic love letter only drag could deliver.
In a one-night-only event, your local drag faves will impersonate, roast, and absolutely trash each other's drag personas.

events.id: Ash Grunwald tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Ash Grunwald tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Australia’s premier bluesman, Ash Grunwald embarks on his first ever full length tour of New Zealand!
Renowned for his electrifying live shows, Ash Grunwald has inspired a generation to hit the road in an old van to ‘surf by day jam by night’.
The festival favourite brings a high energy, vibrant live show with stacks of guitars and foot stomping blues.
Part troubadour, part storyteller - Ash has been selling out shows all over the world!
Don’t miss this chance to see live blues music at it’s finest!

events.description:
Pōneke’s best dressed improv company PopRox are excited to bring their signature format back to Circa in 2025 after a year of sold-out shows in 2024.
Featuring an hour and 15mins of hot improvisers, long-form narrative work and more laughs than you have lung capacity for, this show is sure to have you “frequently laughing so hard [your] chest hurts” — Wellingtonista.
Seated cabaret style in the iconic Circa Bar, PopRox is the perfect way to end your week with a laugh!
Be sure to book early as shows will sell-out.
“This company is so talented at what they do, and you’re missing out by not being there to see it.” — Theatreview “Each of the performers are at the top of their game” – Wellyott “Some of Wellington’s best improv comedians on fire.” – The Post” 7pm – 8.15pm Sunday nights | First show Sunday 30 March DATES: 30 March, 27 April, 25 May, 27 July, 24 August, 28 September, 26 October, 23 November Circa Theatre’s new cafe, bar and brasserie Chouchou $15 – $35 per person (concession and group prices available)

events.id: Nurse John — Short Staffed Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Nurse John — Short Staffed Tour
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
It only hurts when you laugh.
The medical-themed comedy of John Dela Cruz is likely to leave you crying, screaming, and laughing.
His alter-ego, Nurse John, portrays life working in the healthcare industry.
The ‘Nurse John — Short Staffed Tour’ is a delightful romp through the ups and downs of caring for people.
He’s known for his positive presence online as he documents his day-to-day life.

events.id: Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This two-day class is designed for advanced students and focuses on teaching a range of claw setting techniques, along with straightforward construction methods to securely hold gemstones of various shapes and sizes.
The emphasis is on mastering the techniques rather than creating polished, finished jewellery pieces.
Students are encouraged to bring along their own particular tools, metal and stones if they would like to.
Students will then move on to faceted stones and be shown how to construct their own settings in a number of styles, and how to secure their stones in settings.
The workshop will also look at how to use pre-made claw settings to best advantage.

events.id: Art of the Bloom-Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Art of the Bloom
events.venue: Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough
events.description:
Step into the cozy charm of the Ventana studio and spend a hands-on crafternoon learning to create your very own voluminous, oversized crepé paper flower—a sculptural statement piece that’s equal parts art and joy.
In this immersive workshop, you’ll be guided through every step of the process from choosing the perfect colour palette to cutting, curling, shaping, and assembling each petal by hand.
It’s a meditative, rewarding craft that requires patience, but with the right techniques (and a few of my favourite tricks!
), you’ll be amazed at what you can create.
Date & Time: Sun 24th Aug - 10am-1230pm Location: Ventana Art Space 7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough

events.id: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
An opportunity to engage in creative recycling by turning seaside flotsam into precious wearable treasures.
Finish up with your choice of polish, including high lustre gloss, steel brushed satin, or darkened antique finishes.
If you can, please beachcomb and bring along some sea glass options - ideally around 1cm wide, and with a flat back.
Techniques: - Create a ring with one bezel set foraged sea glass ‘gem’ - Use jeweller’s callipers to measure and prepare metal - Use jeweller’s saws or snips to cut and shape metal - Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces - Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal pieces - Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery Project : 1 Ring with sea glass (silver, brass and copper options) Materials: Sea Glass, Copper, Brass, Sterling Silver One hour lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.
Daylong workshop options on either Sunday 20 July or Sunday 24 August.

events.id: Intro to Self Defence Workshop- Harrison Street Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: Intro to Self Defence Workshop
events.venue: Harrison Street Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
Our Intro to Self Defence workshop is designed for anyone who wants to learn effective escapes from grabs and holds as well as simple self defence skills that could save your life.
We encourage parents and children to do this workshop together so you can reinforce the learning at home.
You get to benefit from the skills Sensei Patricia has gained from over 40 years training in karate delivered to you in a fun package!
You will learn how to: - Stay safe - Build awareness and confidence - Defend yourself effectively Cost: $29 NOTE: Family concessions available on request to patricia@familyfitkarate.co.nz.
Ask about our gift vouchers for our Self Defence workshops and Karate memberships.

events.name: Soulful Sunday: Kundalini Yoga and Gong Bath
events.venue: Ruapehu Street Paraparaumu, Wellington
events.description:
This session is held in two parts - come for one or stay for both: ✨ Kundalini Yoga: 12:30–2:00 PM | $35 Move, breathe, and reset your energy with a nourishing Kundalini Yoga practice to clear the mind, reset your energy, and reconnect with your body.
🔔 Gong Bath: 2:30–3:30 PM | $30 Soothe your nervous system and bathe in the healing frequencies of the gong.
This is a deeply restful, restorative session — no movement required, just lie back and receive.
🎟️ Both Sessions: $55 ☕ During the break, enjoy a herbal tea, snack & oracle cards.
Bring a yoga mat, blanket, water bottle and anything you need to feel cozy + supported.

events.id: Breaker bay Raranga-150 Breaker Bay Rd, Breaker Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Breaker bay Raranga
events.venue: 150 Breaker Bay Rd, Breaker Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.description:
Here's what you need to know: • The session runs from 1:00 pm to 4:30 pm.
• New participants should bring 5-10 rau (blades) of harakeke, a sharp pair of scissors, an old towel, and a bag for any unused rau.
• Returning participants should bring 30-40 rau (blades) of harakeke along with their tools.
A Koha (donation) is appreciated in order to cover the cost of room hire, but it is not a requirement for participation.
Come and enjoy the weaving experience while connecting with the rich tradition of Māori arts and crafts.

events.id: House Candle Holder Clay Workshop-The Art and Living Space, 17 Bradey Road, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: House Candle Holder Clay Workshop
events.venue: The Art and Living Space, 17 Bradey Road, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
A fun, relaxing and creative workshop to make a magical clay house which can be used with real or fake candles.
We will use my hand drawn templates, white clay, slab building and modelling techniques, and imprint with fabrics to produce stunning clear glazed white houses.
Also includes the option of adding some dashes of colour accents using underglazes and coloured slips.
I love making houses!
You can add birds, cats, window boxes or whatever inspires to your creation.

events.id: Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This inspiring Sunday afternoon jewellery blocks are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment!
The course starts on Sun 24 August and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 14 September, 2pm-5pm.
Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on quickly to working in silver.
An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items.
Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

events.id: Huntress x A Lady Butcher : Whole Hog Workshop + Wine-Martinborough 5711, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Huntress x A Lady Butcher : Whole Hog Workshop + Wine
events.venue: Martinborough 5711, New Zealand
events.description:
What to Expect: Huntress Experience: Guided by "The Huntress", Jannine Rickards, a passionate advocate for sustainable living and wild wine, you’ll be introduced to a deep, meaningful connection between the land, the food we consume, and the wines we enjoy.
Alongside her teachings, you’ll discover how Huntress Wines reflect indigenous food-growing practices and how each bottle celebrates the connection between the land’s cycles and the wines that grow from them.
Wine Pairing: As you absorb all the knowledge from the Huntress and Butcher, you’ll enjoy expertly paired wines throughout the experience.
Huntress Wines have been carefully chosen to complement each stage of the workshop, with a focus on organic, terroir-driven bottles that reflect the spirit of the land and match exquisitely with the charcuterie selection prepared.
This is a one-of-a-kind workshop that celebrates sustainable practices, the art of butchery, and the symbiotic relationship between the food we eat and the wine we drink.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - SWDC - Martinborough Community Board - In-studio- Texas Street Martinborough, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - SWDC - Martinborough Community Board - In-studio
events.venue: Texas Street Martinborough, Wellington
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.venue: 8 Chews Lane, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
An intoxicating night of poetry reading at elixir, Pōneke's most enchanting boutique cocktail bar, featuring a diverse cast of queer poets including special guest essa may ranapiri!
Come enjoy some fine food and drink and equally fine writing in the heart of the city, the Sunday after Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, for a classy way to top off a weekend of literary events in style.
Doors open 6pm, poetry begins 6:30pm.

events.id: The Zimmermans play Bob Dylan-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: The Zimmermans play Bob Dylan
events.venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
events.description:
Join Aotearoa's pre-eminent Bob Dylan tribute band for a night of rollicking rockin' folkin' funkin' songs from the Bobster - recognised as one of the worlds greatest songwriters.
We have 2000 plus songs to choose from so no - we're not doing them all, just a selection of his greatest hits, some deep cuts into obscurity, and ones we think are worthy of an airing.
Our ten piece band is packed to the gunwales with drums, guitars, brass section, singers, and keyboards to replicate the sound of the man, but also provide our own interpretations of some songs.
Our band members come from all manner of musical outlets, from the Mockers and Let's Planet to the Balkanistas and the Wooden Box Band.
Don't think twice, Lay your lady lay down and get your ticket now cos - y'know This Wheel's on Fire and there ain't no stoppin' the Dylan train.

events.id: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
*Limited door sales for $25* *Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth* Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being.
The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

events.id: The Life of Henry the Fifth-1 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Life of Henry the Fifth
events.venue: 1 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past.
It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.

events.id: Artsplash: Choir-Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Artsplash: Choir
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
ArtSplash is a week-long festival, held every two years, that celebrates tāmariki and rangatahi experiencing performance on the big stage in dance and choir concerts.
This year, we have two separate groups performing – one at ArtSplash and the other at DanceSplash.
Whaea Emilee and Mrs Skippers have an amazing Choir group training to perform on Monday 25 August at the 5pm show, held at the Michael Fowler Centre.
This group will be heading into town by 8:15am and with an action-packed day planned, will stay in town until their 5pm performance.
Following the show, our students will be ready to head home with their spectator parents.

events.id: Leadership Unlocked: collaboratively solving complex school challenges -WLG- Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Leadership Unlocked: collaboratively solving complex school challenges -WLG
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Join us for a one-day workshop designed to elevate your leadership skills by delving into complex problem-solving and equity-focused educational strategies.
Developed and led by Dr. Jacqui Patuawa and Distinguished Professor Emeritus Viviane Robinson, this workshop builds on your existing expertise in leading learning, focusing on the use of double-loop thinking to address underachievement.
As Mumford et al. (2000) stated, “effective leadership behaviour fundamentally depends upon the leader’s ability to solve the kinds of complex social problems that arise in organisations.” In this session, you will: Build trust and foster respectful dialogue.
Accurately identify and analyse challenges affecting student outcomes.
Develop effective solutions that promote equitable educational success.

events.name: Writers on Mondays: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Nina Mingya Powles calls Anna Jackson’s Terrier, Worrier ‘a remarkable and playful book on language, anxiety, poetry, and the strangeness of being a person’.
Somewhere between a diary and a collection of poetic essays, it takes Jackson’s work into previously uncharted territory.
Equally off the charts is filmmaker, writer, and artist Rachel O’Neill’s Symphony of Queer Errands, a delightfully riotous musical fantasia and an irreverent ode to queer joy.
Chris Price will pilot the conversation between these adventurous voyagers in unknown seas.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - HCC - Monday 25th August Production Day Pass-In-studio- Queens Drive Lower Hutt, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - HCC - Monday 25th August Production Day Pass-In-studio
events.venue: Queens Drive Lower Hutt, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Beginner Jewellery Making In 8 Weeks - Mondays-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Beginner Jewellery Making In 8 Weeks - Mondays
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
It starts on Monday 25 August and runs for 8 weeks until Monday 13 October, 5.30-pm - 8 pm.
We start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver, an extra $8 for stones and fine silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals.

events.id: Declarations of Love (And Other Useless Things) | BATS Theatre-1 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Declarations of Love (And Other Useless Things) | BATS Theatre
events.venue: 1 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Created by Tempest Theatre Co Back for its five year anniversary, Emma Maguire and Hamish Boyle run the gauntlet of sketch comedy, performing 15+ sketches about love, sex, queerness and rom-coms in 55 minutes.
It's delirious, it'll get your blood pumping (not like that), and maybe we'll all come out of it satisfied.
Think parodies of Fifty Shades of Grey and the manosphere.
Interrogating love languages and horoscopes.
A lot of ~intimate eye contact~.

events.id: From the Shadows to the Spotlight-100 Willis Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: From the Shadows to the Spotlight
events.venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington
events.description:
You’re invited to a unique leadership event, one that trades buzzwords for real stories and surface-level networking for something deeper.
From the Shadows to the Spotlight Venue: Cliftons Wellington, L28, 100 Willis Street Date: 26th August 2025 Time: 5:00pm–7:15pm Led by Stew Darling, a former covert operator turned leadership expert and founder of Unstoppable Force.
This evening will explore what it means to lead under pressure, navigate the unknown, and stay true to your values when it matters most.
Expect: - 90 minutes of real-world leadership insights - A room full of values-led professionals - Networking over drinks and canapés (provided by Everybody Eats) A chance to support Big Brothers Big Sisters Wellington through a gold coin donation at the door We’re proud to partner with Cliftons to host this free event and would love to see you there.
Spaces are limited, and this one’s going to fill fast.

events.name: Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
I get it.
In this session, you'll learn: Why time management is really attention management How to shift from reacting to designing your days Practical tools to create space for what actually matters How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life.
Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life.
Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

events.id: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Angela Ballantyne-23 Mein St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Angela Ballantyne
events.venue: 23 Mein St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.description:
Inaugural Professorial Lecture "Making things right".
What does it mean to make things right?
Medicine and science often turn to bioethics for concrete solutions to ethical challenges.
But in reality, there is rarely a single, obvious ‘right’ answer.
Human systems are inherently messy, and challenged by a legacy of injustice, unequal distributions of power, and declining social trust.

events.id: Otago Mathematics Leadership Community 2025- Union Street East Room G. Dunedin,-Event Brite
events.name: Otago Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: Union Street East Room G. Dunedin,
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.name: Health and Safety Essentials for Small Business
events.venue: Lambton Quay  Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
The purpose of this course is to give you the oversight you need to ensure your business health and safety systems and processes reflect a best-practice approach.
Each session comes with practical templates for you to use in your business to comply with the Health & Safety at Work Act 2015.
Understand essential health and safety components and how they relate to your legal duties.
Understand practical ways to increase the effectiveness of your health and safety system.
Places are limited, so register today.

events.id: When the Family Fractures: Working Confidently with Separated Families- Taranaki Street Wellington,-Event Brite
events.name: When the Family Fractures: Working Confidently with Separated Families
events.venue: Taranaki Street Wellington,
events.description:
Parental Separation affects a significant proportion of our clients, yet most practitioners receive minimal training in managing these complex family dynamics.
It will help clinicians who feel uncertain when separation dynamics emerge in individual therapy, or who are struggling with managing consent issues and parent involvement.
Especially if you are worried your therapeutic recommendations might complicate legal matters; you're unsure when to take on these cases and when to refer; or your between-session workload with these clients is unsustainable.
You'll Leave Knowing: evidence-based interventions that work in separated family contexts how separation impacts child development and attachment tools to identify red flags, know which cases to accept and when to refer when you need both parents' consent (and when you don't) how to prevent being triangulated and maintain therapeutic boundaries confidence about providing court-appropriate documentation methods to structure sessions and manage between-session contact how to protect yourself legally while maintaining therapeutic effectiveness This workshop is fully catered.
Her approach integrates ACT, Compassion-Focused Therapy, and ProSocial principles with practical strategies drawn from extensive experience in: expert witness testimony in Family Court proceedings court-mandated therapy for families in legal disputes child and adolescent mental health services youth justice system intervention perinatal mental health support working with neurodivergent children and their families Her career spans leadership roles including Past President of the ANZ Association for Contextual Behavioural Science, Research Associate for Telethon Kids Institute, and Council Member for Collaborative Practice Western Australia.

events.id: Management Essentials Training 26 - 27 August 2025-5, ANZAC House 181 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Management Essentials Training 26 - 27 August 2025
events.venue: 5, ANZAC House 181 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The Management Essentials Training has been developed by Clubs New Zealand and is aimed at upskilling Managers who would like to improve their knowledge around compliance issues and obtain a detailed understanding of the various components clubs traditionally earn revenue from.
The course is aimed at anyone who is new to club management, moving into club management or even those who have years of experience and want to refresh their knowledge and skills.
The course provides numerous opportunities for discussion and to explore ideas, issues or questions participants have, some of the topics covered on the course include; Who is Clubs New Zealand and what we can assist with via our website or in person, Basic accounting requirements for your club – Audits, Gaming accounts, “KISS”, Legislation that effects your club - The Sale & Supply of Alcohol Act 2012, Incorporated Societies Act, Food Bill etc., Gaming – best practices, Business Partners – making them work for your Club.
Two days The cost of the two day course is $190.00 per person (plus accommodation and travel).

Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

events.id: Wellington Leaders Day-22 Tennyson Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Leaders Day
events.venue: 22 Tennyson Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Testimonies are emerging from churches across Aotearoa of an openness to faith, responses from people previously not interested in church, and a curiosity about Christ and Christianity among non-believers, particularly young people.
As church and Christian leaders in Aotearoa New Zealand, how might we respond in our contexts?
Session Two: Stories of Renewal In this panel discussion, local pastors and leaders share stories of how they are seeing that God has been moving — stirring renewal and hope, unexpected shifts in discipleship and salvations, and how they are responding.
Session Four: Renewal Conversations What does it look like to steward renewal in our churches?
This session focuses on practical responses to renewal and discussion around how the Church in Aotearoa can partner with what the Spirit is doing.

✅ Writing Business Posts That Connect – Creating content that will help you actually keep, gain and attract business not just likes & followers ✅ Social Media & Search Visibility – How consistent posting helps customers find your business.

Whether you're a social media beginner or looking to sharpen your skills, this workshop will give you practical, easy-to-implement strategies to make social media work for you.

events.name: August Work Smarter Horowhenua - Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses
events.venue: 102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
More people are using AI, without understanding how it works, without telling their employers that they are using it, without considering the implications, and without knowing how to get the most from the tools they’re using.
This is where AI literacy becomes essential - it’s not just knowing how to use AI tools, it’s about understanding what’s possible, and knowing you don’t need to be technically savvy to use it well.
This practical two-hour in-person workshop is for real people in real businesses; who want to use AI to do more with the resources and tools they already have.

I’ve spent my career helping teams work smarter, minimise risks and leverage opportunities that come from doing business in our fast-changing world.

events.description:
Expect the unexpected from Wellington-based Agatha Pantha - a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers.
Fronted by singer and ukelele player Mo Blishen, and filled out with Kent Hogan on guitar, Nik Straughier on bass and Sam King on drums, Agatha Pantha is the product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the every day.

Joined by Scott Pilgrim, Darrel Greaney and Ben McHardy.

events.id: Your Life’s Purpose – Discover Your Emotional Needs and Core Values-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Your Life’s Purpose – Discover Your Emotional Needs and Core Values
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.
Let the emotional knowledge you gain inform not only how you live your life but also how you feel about living it.
To do this you’ll identify your values hierarchy and learn about how this framework can inform how you live your life.
Once you can apply a spirit of consistency to your self-identified larger purpose, as well as your needs, then your life’s purpose, emotional needs and core values, will align.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Develop a Life Purpose Statement Perform an Emotional Needs Self-Assessment Elicit Your Core Values Align your goals with your life purpose, emotional needs and core values Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Bike Maintenance for Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Bike Maintenance for Beginners
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
We’ll cover what to look out for when things start to wear out, and how to check for problems, so you can be confident your bicycle is safe to ride.
Those who feel intimidated in bike shops are especially welcome in this course.
Regardless of whether your bike is in pristine condition, or desperately in need of TLC, it is welcome on the course – bikes showing a bit more wear can be useful for the learning of the whole group.
If you have the following, please bring them as well:  A multi-tool and pump; chain oil and rag; lightweight close-fitting gardening or rubber gloves.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Name most parts of a bicycle correctly - Perform a quick safety check on any bicycle - Fix a flat tyre - Adjust your bike to fit your body - Oil and clean your chain - Identify and fix some common brake problems Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Cooking: Lentils – Types, Recipes and How to Cook Them The lentil is perhaps the world’s most versatile and indestructible food.
It has significant health benefits from lowering cholesterol to supporting weight loss – and lentils are delicious when cooked well.
Enjoy this half-day course that will show you how to cook lentils properly and make the most of this nutritious staple ingredient.
Discover spices to complement and enhance lentils and create some mouth-watering dishes.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Creative Writing - From Idea to Page-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Creative Writing - From Idea to Page
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Creative Writing - From Idea to Page “Just write!” That’s the advice given to every newbie writer… but what happens when you struggle to get words on the page?
Please bring pen and paper.
Tea and coffee available for your breaks, please bring lunch and any snacks you may need.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Identify different brainstorming methods - Complete writing exercises to develop ideas - Describe your own writing process, and identify what works for you - Apply strategies to keep up writing momentum Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.name: Intro to Standup Comedy
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Intro to Standup Comedy In this class you will learn to: Develop creative practices to generate and explore comedic ideas Craft your ideas into standup comedy jokes and routines Maximize laughter with great delivery Overcome your stage fright and become a more confident presenter During class, we’ll write together, craft bits, play games, share material, and give you some fun, low-pressure practice on the mic.
By the end of the day, you’ll have heaps of your own ideas to explore further onstage, an understanding of tools used by professional comics, and the motivation and skills to brave your first or next open mic.

events.id: Knitting - Next Level-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Knitting - Next Level
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Knitting - Next Level Build on your learning from the Beginner’s Knitting class.
Learn how to read a knitting ball band and knitting pattern as well as gain a basic understanding of knitting abbreviations.
You will have practiced the wraps per inch method, practiced a couple of techniques as outlined by knitting abbreviations and understand tension as both a principle and practical guide in the craft of knitting.
By the end of the session you’ll be able to: Read a knitting ball band Know how to determine yarn weight using the wraps per inch method Read a basic knitting pattern Run through of basic knitting abbreviations (reference sheet provided) Understand tension: what is it, why you make tension swatches and how to alter tension as needed.
Explore the rules of substituting yarn Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Oil Painting Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Oil Painting Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Oil Painting Workshop In this course we will learn about painting with oils: one of the oldest and most interesting mediums, and one which has an undeserved reputation for being slow or intimidating!
In this workshop we will learn some quick methods for getting started in oils, using “alla prima” (wet on wet) methods to develop an understanding of the painting process.
In addition to learning about the practical side of the medium, there will also be opportunities to learn a bit about the extraordinary history of painting in oils.
Basic paint colours provided, you're welcome to bring along any that you may already have at home.
- Develop transparent glazes and washes over your painting.

events.id: Women's Health and Aging Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Women's Health and Aging Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $109 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.
The objective of this workshop is to give you knowledge and understanding about how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as we age as women.
Trunk stability versus core strength as we age and the impact on our other core muscles and pelvic floor will be discussed.
-The importance of the diaphragm and breathing well will also be discussed to enhance optimal movement and function for women.
Please wear comfortable clothes and socks as this is an interactive workshop, and bring a yoga mat or beach towel.

events.name: Zine Making - Introduction
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Zine Making - Introduction In this workshop you will be guided in making a classic cut and fold 8-page zine from a standard A4 sheet of paper - this is a clever design you can easily photocopy and reproduce later!
You will be introduced to a range of techniques and approaches such as cut and paste photos and text, collage and drawing on paper.
Paper, newspapers, magazines and basic drawing materials will be provided.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Cut and fold a classic 8-page zine format from a single sheet of paper Brainstorm content ideas for your personalised zine publications Arrange & compose text and images to fit a classic 8-page zine layout Combine cut & paste magazine content with hand drawn/ written content Create a draft zine of your personal interests Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: Cooking: Gourmet Sausage Making
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Cooking: Gourmet Sausage Making Come along and learn how to fill sausage casings with a tasty mincemeat and get tips and tricks on how to make your own customized sausage mixes at home with the use of various herbs and spices.
Everyone will get some sausages to take home and enjoy.
All ingredients included in course fee but please bring your apron, a dish cloth and a couple of tea towels to the session.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Recognise how to handle a knife safely -  Understand food safety and hygiene around sausage-making and avoiding cross contamination -  Recognise the difference between two kinds of sausage casings and why you use each of them -  Have some ideas on how to make and cook a good quality sausage properly -  Be able to safely store sausages products Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.venue: Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
events.description:
It's important that all teams participate in pre-scrutineering to ensure you are on track for your vehicle to meet the technical specifications and safety requirements necessary for race day.
Many vehicles will not be complete and that is okay – students will be given feedback with time to make modifications or corrections before the regional final.
We strongly encourage all teams to attend pre-scrutineering, this is the second most important event of the year and all about making sure your vehicle is safe and that you get to race your vehicle at regional finals!
Teams will need to do a drive-by drop off of their vehicles and find parking either onsite or on the nearby streets.
Contact School Co-ordinator // Annabelle Batchelor // 027 4100 633 // annabelle@evolocity.co.nz

Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track, explain The Grogans.
Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.
Usually, I’m in the same spot whilst mixing and can come and go from each track mentally, but this time the album was attached to us at the hip.

events.id: Financial Planning for Retirement-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Financial Planning for Retirement
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
If you have not planned for your retirement, then this course is you!
This course has been developed for people in their 50’s or 60’s that are looking at retirement and have no idea if they can financially survive it: what to do, what $’s they need, how or where they can generate additional income, or even where to go to get help.
At each step, key considerations and financial concepts will be defined, explained and discussed to help you understand the financial requirements of retirement.
A step by step planning process will be taught by working through a case study.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
The morning will begin with simple design examples and techniques using specialist jewellers’ tools, working with copper or brass.
In the afternoon you will form and craft your own ring from sterling silver.
All materials included in course fee.
Please bring pen and paper and wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.
By the end of the course, you'll be able to: • Create a silver band • Demonstrate techniques for working sterling silver • Perform metal forming, piercing and texturing skills • Use essential jewellery-making tools accurately Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:

The route is 2.5km and requires reasonable physical fitness due to the steep terrain and unsealed paths in places.

If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day by 9am by email and on our Facebook page.

events.id: Leadership And Management Part 1-AREA Meetings and Events, 1 O'Reily Ave, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Leadership And Management Part 1
events.venue: AREA Meetings and Events, 1 O'Reily Ave, Wellington
events.description:
Learn how to make the transition from buddy to the boss and lead a successful team.
Managing staff can be a very rewarding, interesting and fun role, it can also be a tough and demanding job.
Between managing your own time and projects, helping your team members solve problems and complete tasks, and helping other managers, your day can fill up before you know it.
This workshop aims to maximise your leadership and management potential and help you become a more confident, effective and efficient leader and manager with information on understanding personality types, effective communication, setting expectations and goals, assigning work, effective delegation, motivating staff, leadership styles, giving feedback and having courageous conversations, understanding what is required to be a good leader and manager and encouraging teamwork.
The workshop is designed for those who have been promoted recently into a supervisory management role or for those who have been there for some time but need to improve their leadership and management skills.

Lower Hutt Parents Centre ispart of a national voluntary-led, not-for-profit organisation who provide high quality ChildbirthEducation Classes (Antenatal Classes), Baby & You Classes and other Parent EducationClasses for Hutt Valley families.
We are here to help.
Our comprehensive Antenatal Classes lead by qualified Childbirth Educators will help you prepare for labour, birth and the early days with a newborn.
From time to time a 'weekend intensive' course which runs for two full days is held on consecutive Saturdays.
Courses cost $220 (including booking fee) The course covers: • Nutrition and exercise during pregnancy • Labour signs and stagesWe • Pain relief options and interventions • The birth process • Breastfeeding and newborn care • Transition to Parenthood and practical parenting • A tour of Hutt Hospital maternity unit, either physical or virtual tour We encourage you to enrol early to ensure you get a spot.

events.id: Shaun Kirk - New Zealand Tour 2025-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Shaun Kirk - New Zealand Tour 2025
events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer.
His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!
Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard (Buzz Mag).
Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.
Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence.

events.id: Mallrat - Light Hits My Face Like A Straight Right-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Mallrat - Light Hits My Face Like A Straight Right
events.venue: Meow, Wellington
events.description:
Mallrat Brings “Light Hit My Face Like A Straight Right” Tour To New Zealand Australian indie pop princess Mallrat will return to New Zealand this September on the Light Hit My Face Like a Straight Right World Tour, following a run of sold out shows across Europe and USA.
Sophomore album Light Hit My Face Like A Straight brings dance music that has heart and potent magic which will be manifested into life on stage, alongside all your favourite Mallrat hits and accompanied by her incredible live band.
The adored songwriter and producer’s work catapulted Mallrat across the globe with critical acclaim from NPR, Stereogum, NME, NYLON, PAPER Magazine, The New York Times, Billboard, Noisey and more, further affirming Mallrat as a beacon primed for the world stage in 2025.
Joining Mallrat on her New Zealand headline shows is none other than Aotearoa’s own indie pop darling, Riiki Reid — bringing her signature style and infectious energy to the stage for an unforgettable night of music.
New Zealand Headline Dates 11th September, Meow 13th September, Tuning Fork Also appearing at Snow Machine In Queenstown Tickets will be available this Wednesday 9am NZST from lilmallrat.com

events.description:
Following the release of their debut album TREK and a string of sold-out shows across Sydney (Eora), Brisbane (Meanjin), and Melbourne (Naarm), Sydney post-punk trio Shady Nasty announce their debut tour in Aotearoa/New Zealand this September.
A world bound by modding cars, immigrant heritage and digital obsessions, Kevin Stathis, Haydn Green and Luca Watson, together play a left-field breed of punk that recalibrates their formal training to its most uncustomary extremes.
Wherever they play and no matter the room size, devout adherents clammer to propel a heaving mosh.
Experience TREK live as Shady Nasty debut the record with an all-new live show, with special guests to be announced.

events.id: PIG DESTROYER-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: PIG DESTROYER
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone-razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and alone, stark howl-and use them to commit a vicious assault.
The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience.
These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status.
Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal.
To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.name: Leadership And Management Part 2
events.venue: AREA Meetings and Events, 1 O'Reily Ave, Wellington
events.description:
Learn how to make the transition from buddy to boss and lead a successful team.
As John F. Kennedy once said, “leadership and learning are indispensable to each other”.
Our Leadership & Management courses are designed to help you get the best performance from yourself and your team, providing you with the skills and techniques to become better than you ever perceived you could be.
The Leadership & Management Part 2 workshop will equip leaders and managers with the skills to build high performing and highly motivated teams; the skills to communicate effectively as a leader, become more self-aware, provide coaching and mentoring, deal with conflict in a constructive and productive manner along with developing ways to solve problems as a team.
This workshop also gives participants an understanding of the key concepts of leadership and leadership styles along with how to choose and implement a leadership style that is authentic and beneficial to both the organisation and the teams they serve.

events.venue: 34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The Futuna Lecture Series commenced in 2011 and has been one of the main annual events on the NZ Architectural calendar for the last 14 years.
The additional support of these new sponsors is very much appreciated and ensures that the Futuna Chapel Trust can continue to attract speakers to NZ of a similar calibre to that of the 2025 Futuna Lecture, Francis Kéré.
The Trust takes this opportunity to thank Metalcraft Roofing for their support of the Futuna Lecture Series from 2012 - 2024.
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work and well as that of the Kéré Foundation.
The Trust will donate 20% of the ticket income to the Kéré Foundation to support the work of Francis Kéré in Gando, Burkina Faso.

events.id: Compliance made SME-asy: Health & Safety Essentials with MD Safety Consulting-Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Compliance made SME-asy: Health & Safety Essentials with MD Safety Consulting
events.venue: Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand
events.description:
Are you a small business owner or manager wanting to improve your health and safety practices but not sure where to start?
Join Mallory from MD Safety Consulting Ltd, for a 90-minute interactive workshop designed specifically for small businesses like yours.
This workshop will cut through the confusion and provide practical, easy-to-implement strategies to help you meet legal requirements, keep your team safe, and build a strong safety culture.
What You’ll Learn: Health & Safety Compliance & Documentation – The essential documents you need (without unnecessary admin) Hazard & Risk Management – How to identify risks, assess them, and control them effectively Worker Engagement & Training – Simple ways to involve your team and ensure proper safety training Emergency Procedures – Creating an easy-to-follow emergency plan tailored to your business Incident Reporting & Investigation – How to report and learn from incidents to prevent future harm What You’ll Get: Practical tools & templates to apply immediately in your business Resource sheet linking to free NZ-based safety tools A chance to ask questions and get expert guidance Mallory understands the challenges of running a small business, and is passionate about helping business owners navigate health and safety in a way that is simple, effective, and realistic.
Whether you're starting from scratch or refining your current systems, this workshop will give you actionable steps to improve safety and compliance in your workplace.

The concert will feature new songs such as honky tonk country infused hit Trippin’ on You and the anthemic So Sorry, alongside classic JBT tunes, Zebra and Better Than as well as opus guitar instrumental, Ocean.

events.description:
From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable.
Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label.
His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.
In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.
Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

Tāmaki Makaurau jangle heroes Cowboy Dan set out across Te Ika-a-Māui to celebrate the release of their debut full-length album, Dreams That Feel Like Falling.
Once aptly described as The Bats on the right amount of Red Bull, Cowboy Dan has been treating audiences across the motu to energetic, emotionally charged tunes since 2015.
Their live shows have consistently delivered good times to fans and new friends alike.
Off the back of two delightful EPs: We Will Hesitate, When We Eventually Wait (2017, Mixed by Jonathan Pearce); Sentimental Now That We're Leaving (2021, Mixed by Rohan Evans), the debut LP, Dreams That Feel Like Falling, showcases the bands expansive sonic pallet, with a mix of distortion, introspection, heart and bite.

Folk Bitch Trio Debut headline show in Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington Melbourne’s alluring Folk Bitch Trio have announced their debut album release tour of New Zealand, playing headline shows in Auckland, Wellington & Christchurch.
Now Would Be A Good Time, the debut album by Folk Bitch Trio, tells vivid, visceral stories.
It wasn’t long before she messaged Peverelle and Sinclair, asking if they’d be interested in starting a “folk bitch trio.”  As soon as they started singing together, their connection deepened, and “the chemistry of being inspired by each other was evident from the get-go,” says Sinclair.
Listening to Folk Bitch Trio, it’s clear that this is a band of three distinct points of view, with contrasting and complementary backgrounds and visions.
Sinclair is the self-proclaimed jester of the group, but her taste skews dark, gothic, baroque and dramatic, expressed as a love of opera and ballet as well as musicians as wide-ranging as Patti Smith, Nirvana and Tchaikovsky.

events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
Theme: Strengthening self-resources Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
This single workshop helps teens to use drawing to access their inner resources, because often they have the guidance within, and just need help to bring it out.
Dates This is a single workshop: 4.15pm-5.30pm Monday 29 September – Strengthening self-resources Cost $46 total Included in each session You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance.
With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

Date This is a single workshop 6.15pm-7.30pm Monday 29 September Cost $46 total Included in each session You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance.
With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.venue: 98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.description:
A full 5Rhythms® weekend workshop in Paekākāriki, Wellington, New Zealand Join us for a deep dive into the skeletal landscape of the body—where form and movement provoke the memory of our animal, and mineral cells/selves.
In this weekend immersion, we’ll uncover the bones—exploring the structure, strength, support, and vitality that arise when we embody our bony architecture.
Through the 5Rhythms map, we’ll trace, align, and articulate the inner scaffolding that grounds our shapes, holds us upright, and upon which we can align our sense of self.
Her approach weaves embodied storytelling, deep listening, and transformative movement.
All willing movers are welcome.
